loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 26-year-old Ramatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 7 months and 5 years. She started this business so that she will be able to take care of family and her children..

Ramatu runs a food business; she sells cooked food at home. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business for 11 hours per day, seven days per week. Ramatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities including rice, coconut oil, cooking seasonings and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food commodities including rice, coconut oil, cooking seasonings and soft drinks

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Vive Group

texts.es:
DÚO CRISTO VIVE

El grupo está conformado por la señoras quienes son María Consuelo  ella necesita otro crédito para surtir más su venta de productos de consumo diario (pastas, jabones, maíz y frijol) y de esa forma poder ofrecerles diversidad de  productos a sus clientes su deseo es seguir creciendo  y de esa forma darle el estudio a sus hijos, también comprar otra refrigeradora para el uso de su negocio,esperando que ustedes le puedan seguir ayudando para que ella siga adelante.
texts.en:
DÚO CRISTO VIVE

The group is comprised of the women.  María Consuelo needs another loan for more stock for her sales of daily consumption products (pasta, soap, corn, and beans).  This way she will be able to offer her customers a diversity of products.  Her wish is to continue growing.  In this way she will give her children an education.  She will also buy another refrigerator to use in her business.  She is hoping that you are able to continue helping her so that she will get ahead.

loans.use: to buy daily consumption products.

loans.name: Erika Merari

texts.es: Erika Merari, habita junto a su padre en casa familiar. Tiene 20 años de edad y es muy emprendedora. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los insumos que utiliza en su negocio. Erika se dedica a la  elaboración y venta de tortillas(preparación alimenticia hecha con masa de maíz)tanto para el almuerzo como para la cena. Es muy reconocida en su comunidad por ser una jovencita muy entregada en su trabajo y ofrecer productos higiénicos y a muy buenos precios. Tiene la visión de ver crecer su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos de tal forma que ella y su padre puedan  mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con esta visión se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este préstamo que le permita invertir en su negocio en la compra de maíz y gas propano que son los principales insumos que utiliza en la elaboración de las tortillas. Espera poder contar con esta ayuda ya que sus ingresos no le permiten aumentar el volumen de oferta hacia sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erika Merari lives with her father in the family home.  She’s 20-years-old and very enterprising.  She rises very early to start preparing the ingredients she uses in her business.  Erika works making and selling tortillas (a food item made from corn dough) for lunch and dinner.  

She’s very well-known in her community for being a young woman who is very dedicated to her work and who offers hygienic products at very good prices.  She seeks to make her business grow and be able to increase her income so she and her father can improve their quality of life.

On this occasion, she approached FUSAI to request this loan that will make it possible for her to invest in her business with the purchase of corn and propane which are the main ingredients used to make tortillas.  She hopes to get this support because her income is insufficient for her to increase volume of offer to customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noé de 50 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre quien está bajo su responsabilidad.  Don Noé es un hombre trabajador, dedicado y  responsable.  Desde hace muchos años se dedica al comercio informal. Cuenta con un pequeño negocio en el cual vende variedad de sandalias y zapatos para dama. La venta la realiza en diferentes comunidades de su municipio, y es muy reconocido por vender productos de buena calidad y a precios accesibles a sus clientes. Últimamente ha notado que sus productos son muy solicitados y muchas veces no logra cubrir la demanda, es por esta razón que ha pensado en invertir en su pequeño negocio para incrementar su inventario y poder mejorar sus ganancias. Esta es la razón por la cual se dirigió a FUSAI (Fundación Salvadoreña de Apoyo Integral) para solicitar este crédito que le permita hacer la inversión que desea, confía en su experiencia que los resultados serán exitosos y podrá mejor su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Noé, 50, lives with his mother who is in his care in a house he owns.  He’s a hardworking, dedicated, responsible man.  He’s been an informal merchant for many years.  He has a small business in which he sells women’s shoes and sandals.  He does so in various communities in his municipality and is very well-known for selling his customers good quality products at affordable prices.  

He’s noticed lately that his goods are in high demand and he’s often unable to meet it which is why he’s decided to invest in his small business to increase stock inventory and improve profits.  This is why he approached FUSAI (Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development) to request this loan that will make it possible for him to make the investment he desires.  He trusts that his experience will lead to successful results and he will be able to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children.  In 2006, Mariatu established a retail business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometime sales are very difficult.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Mabinty from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with six children. Two of her children are attending school. She started this business because she wants to generate income to support her needs.

Mabinty runs a food business; she sells cooked food at home. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 11 hours per day, seven days per week. Mabinty says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mabinty has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities including rice, palm oil, cooking seasonings and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to renovate her house and build a shop where she can expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food commodities including rice, palm oil, cooking seasonings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu, she is a 28-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with two children.  In 2008, Kadiatu established her fish business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is obtaining fish when the weather is rough.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives close to Matuga, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps close to the coast and large passionfruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Rashid is married, and has nine children. He has been farming for twenty years, and is currently growing cashew nuts on his land. Rashid was attracted to beekeeping because it will give him another revenue source from his land, and is not a strenuous activity. 

This is Rashid’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start an indigenous chicken project (Kenyan chickens, while not quite as good as their domesticated counterparts at laying eggs, are very hardy, disease resistant and resourceful, effectively feeding themselves). His hope for the future is “to create a retirement fund from honey sales.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Las Chicualenses Group

texts.en:
The traditional “traje” (pronounced “tra-hay”) or traditional dress of the native Maya of Guatemala is among the most colorful and beautiful in the Americas. It is a visual expression of their identity, and can reflect their ethnicity, gender, politics, wealth and nationality. Each town prizes its own unique designs and many consider those from the large town of Chichicastenango to be among the most intricate and exquisite. They are handmade and very durable.

Chicua is a small, poor community near the town. Men, women and children face daily struggles to survive and move forward in their lives. The seventeen hard-working women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Las Chicualenses” have a vision for a better future, and look forward to their monthly meetings.

They are currently requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge, which will be their second loan cycle. The women’s average age is 33 years and they have a very low level of education, with only a few having attended elementary school. Most do not write or speak in Spanish. The ladies have large families and are committed to providing for their children. They realize that education is a real key to a more successful future.

The Secretary for this loan cycle is 24 year old Antonia. As is customary for unmarried women in the rural, indigenous communities of Guatemala, Antonia lives with her parents and siblings. She was only able to attend school until she reached the 4th grade. Since childhood, Antonia has been using her talents to embroider and weave. Currently, she owns an embroidery business and makes beautiful sashes and blouses. As her business is growing, Antonio decided to apply for her second loan with Friendship Bridge, which she will use to purchase various high quality thread. Antonia will plan carefully as she wants to take advantage of the special orders that she has received. She anticipates more sales as the holidays approach. As Antonia works with her sister, the loan will become working capital for both of them. This is especially important as her sister is currently going through a divorce and needs to support herself and her own children.

loans.use: to purchase various high quality of thread to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toothpaste, tooth brushes and shampoo.

loans.name: Amer Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Amer” está conformado por diez integrantes todas son mujeres muy responsables pero sobretodo muy entregadas con sus negocios cada una de ellas esta solicitando un crédito para invertir en sus negocios: Angélica invertirá en ropa, Thalia invertirá en su estética, Francisca y Rosario en la tienda de abarrotes, Felisa, Araceli, Martina  y Laura invertirán en borregos, Rebeca en tienda escolar y María en dulces. 

Doña Angélica o Ange, como le dicen de cariño, tiene 41 años de edad; está casada con el señor Bernardo desde hace 24 años juntos formaron una familia con una hija la cual esta estudiando. Doña Ange se dedica a la venta de ropa, dulces, artículos escolares y artículos de fantasía desde hace 12 años. Dice que inició vendiendo su ropa de casa en casa con sus vecinas, amigas y familiares nunca le gusto vender en las plazas ni en los mercados. Además siempre les dio a sus clientes la facilidad de comprar en dos pagos y hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo; sin embargo, esta es la mayor preocupación para Doña Ange porque muchas veces las personas nunca le terminan de pagar. “Me gustaría vender al contado pero comprendo que estamos en una comunidad donde no hay mucha fuete de ingresos y aunque necesite dinero al instante y pida el pago de inmediato podría perder clientas”. Doña Ange solo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero cuando tuvo oportunidad de tener un local propio su esposo la motivó a vender dulces; inició comprando cajas de dulces muy pequeñas y ahora ya tiene su mesa llena de dulces, galletas y refrescos. El negocio de Doña Ange es muy productivo, tiene muchas clientas aunque también hay días en que las ventas son bajas. La única meta de Doña Ange es poder llegar hacer crecer su negocio para tener suficientes ingresos y poder ayudar a su hija con los gastos de su educación ya que para ella es muy importante que su hija termine una carrera profesional.

¿Te gustaría ayudar a Doña Ange a cumplir sus sueños?
texts.en:
The “Amer” Group up is made up of 10 members; all are very responsible women, but above all very committed to their businesses. Each one of them is requesting a loan to invest in their business: Angelica will invest in clothing, Thalia will invest in her beauty salon, Francisca and Rosario in their grocery store, Felisa, Araceli, Martina and Laura will invest in sheep, Rebecca in a school supplies store, and Maria in candy. 

Angelica, or Ange as she is affectionately called, is 41 years old and has been married to Bernardo for 24 years. Together they form a family with a daughter who is going to school. Angie has been selling clothing, candy, school supplies and novelty items for 12 years. She says that she started selling her clothing door-to-door to her neighbors, friends and family members. She never liked to sell in squares or markets. In addition she always gave her customers the convenience of buying in two payments, and so far continues to do so. However this is Ange's greatest concern because many times people never finish paying her. "I would like to sell on credit, but I understand we are in a community where there are not many sources of income, and even though I need the money right away and ask for immediate payment, I could lose customers". 

Angie only sold clothing, but when she had the opportunity of having her own shop, her husband encouraged her to sell candy. She started by buying very small boxes of candy and now already has a table full of candy, cookies and soft drinks. 

Ange's business is very productive; she has many customers although there also days when sales are low. Ange's only goal is to succeed in expanding her business so that she can have sufficient revenue and be able to help her daughter with her education expenses.  For her is very important that her daughter finish her degree. Would you like to help Angie to fulfill her dreams?

loans.use: To buy clothing.

location.town: La Cienega, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Group 5 At Lien Mac

texts.en: Phuong, pictured first on the right in the front row, is 52 years old and has two grown children. She and her husband are farmers and make about $33 (700,000 VND) a month. Her household currently does not have a hygienic toilet. A member of the Women's Union since 1982, Phuong has joined a campaign to improve her community's sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, Phuong will build a sanitary toilet that will improve her family's hygiene and quality of life and contribute to the overall health of the community.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, de 60 años, está casado con Rosa y vive con una de sus hijas en su casa propia. Marcos es un hombre inteligente y participativo. Desde joven empezó con las actividades agrícolas. “Tengo como 30 años en la agricultura, he pasado muchas cosas buenas y malas, pero todo te enseña”, menciona. Él cultiva arvejas, papas y flores de gladiolos mayormente, porque también siembra maíz y cebada, pero en pocas cantidades. Dice que para que una siembra sea rentable, se debe arriesgar en invertir. Su meta más cercana es abrir una tienda de artículos para instalar sistemas de irrigación al lado de su hijo. Por ahora se enfoca en sembrar más arvejas y maíz, y así continuar con sus ahorros. Él requiere de se apoyo para lograr estos objetivos. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación.
Marcos, invertirá los S/.3800 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marcos, 60, is married to Rosa and lives with one of their daughters in their own home. 

Marcos is an intelligent and social man. He has worked as a farmer since he was very young. "I have like 30 years in the farming industry. A lot of good and bad things have happened, but you always learn something" he says. He mostly grows peas, potatoes and gladiolus flowers but he also grows corn and barley, but in small quantities. 

He says that for a harvest to be profitable you must risk by investing. His next goal is to open a store that sells items to install irrigation systems with his son. 

But for now he is focused on planting more peas and corn and in this way keep saving. He will need support to reach these goals. 

This is his fifth Kiva loan. Every time he has proven to be a responsible and committed person. 

Marcos will invest the 3,800 PEN ($1,375) in purchasing organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Martha Esther

texts.es: Una jovencita con muchos deseos de superarse es Martha, quien actualmente habita en casa de sus padres, tiene la edad de 24 años, es madre de un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Martha trabaja como estilista en un salón particular y para apoyarse un poco más ahora que ya es madre, también alquila cuartos para mantener las necesidades de su hijo. Martha ha venido haciéndole mejoras a la vivienda por etapas, en esta ocasión solicita crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y terminar de hacer un cuarto, aprovechando los muros en la parte trasera de su casa en donde hará la obra para alquiler. Con este ingreso brindara su apoyo a la familia.
texts.en: Martha is a young woman with a strong self-improvement drive who is currently living in her parents’ house.  She’s 24-years-old and mother of an 8-month-old son.  Martha works as a hair stylist in a private salon and to earn a bit more now that she’s a mother rents rooms to cover her son’s needs.  Martha has been making home improvements in stages and on this occasion requests the loan to buy building materials to finish building a room taking advantage of her house’s rear walls where she’ll add the rental rooms.  This income will help her support her family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
When Jesus and his family moved from Colombia to the United States, a small print shop in Miami provided employment for him, his wife and children. When the owners decided to sell the business, Jesus used all his savings to purchase the print shop that provided his family's livelihood. His shop, Centro de Artes Graficas & Mysticas, does all types of printing -- banners, business cards, flyers, religious booklets/pamphlets and promotional materials. 

Now that he is the owner, Jesus has decided to upgrade the business to provide better services and attract new customers. With this loan, Jesus will purchase a new printer and create a website for the business. Help Jesus grow his business and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new printer (Xerox) and create a website

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 28 years old. He is a father of two children. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, Clement wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing, such as quality seeds, from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance, in case of crop failure. As the cooperative's leader, Clement will be responsible for repaying the loan.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jennifer De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Jennifer, hoy en día es madre de una  niña, con dificultades logro culminar su carrera de Lic. en administración de empresas. Siempre dedicada a su pulpería con la cual se ayuda para sus gastos y ahora los de su hija, por lo que  ahora más que nunca Jennifer busca la manera de salir adelante. Solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio con productos de granos básicos, carne, pollo, reposterías, golosinas, con esta inversión espera mantener sus ingresos. Ella desea en un futuro poner un cyber café para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Young Jennifer today is mother of a little girl.  With difficulty she succeeded in completing her Bachelor’s in Business Administration.  She’s always worked in her grocery store that helps her cover her expenses and now her daughter’s as well which is why now more than ever Jennifer seeks a way to get ahead.

She’s asking for this loan to invest in her store with basic grains, meat, chicken, baked goods and snacks to maintain her income level.  She hopes in future to open an Internet café to improve her economy.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store

loans.name: Vitalino

texts.es: Vitalino de 53 años de edad soltero desde hace 4 años el se ha dedicado a la elaboracion y venta de pan en el area donde el vive,en esta oportunidad el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina y materiales para la elaboracion de pan esperando que le puedan ayudar con este credito solicitado ya que el sueño de el es tener un lugar propio donde vivir ya que la casa donde actualmente vive el y su familia es alquilada.
texts.en: Vitalino is 53 years old and is single. For four years, he has made a living baking and selling bread in the area where he lives. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy flour and equipment to bake bread. He hopes that Kiva lenders can help him with this loan, since his dream is to have his own place to live, because the house where he and his family currently live is rented.

loans.use: to buy flour and equipment to make bread to sell.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 3 hijos, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Lizbeth no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Lizbeth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, adicionalmente tiene una mototaxi la cual alquila a chóferes para que brinden servicios de transporte, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo. 
Lizbeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Lizbeth, 35, is a woman living in the city of Pucallpa with her three children; she’s a hardworking single mother who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to go to work, Lizbeth was unable to study the professional career of Nursing like she wanted to.

On her own initiative, Lizbeth works at a small business selling second-hand clothing and also has a mototaxi she leases to drivers to provide transportation services.  She works every day for about 10 hours and thinks she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Lizbeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy larger amounts of clothes to stock her business and continue working and striving to reach her great dream: that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of merchandise.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Wilmer no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Wilmer trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Wilmer se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara la mercadería que necesita para abastecer su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 25, is a man living in the city of Pucallpa with his parents and siblings.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic with a strong self-improvement drive.  Sadly, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work, Wilmer was unable to study a professional Law career like he’d wanted to.

On his own initiative, Wilmer works in his small grocery sales business.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Wilmer is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy merchandise he needs to stock his store to continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a proper, safe house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and their only child. He is a member of a group called Magua en Desarrollo, located in a rural area of the city of Hato Mayor. This is his sixth loan which he will use to improve his house. Jose's business, started with his first loan from Esperanza Internacional, involves selling animals, such as pigs, chickens, etc. After his most recent loan which he invested in his business, Jose realized the need to finish building his home's structure by covering the concrete block wall with cement, making the floor, changing the roof and also buying windows, doors and paint. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in repaying their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. 

Jose thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, sand, concrete blocks, zinc for the roof, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Sajcabilla Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sajcavilla

El grupo está conformado por la señora Deura quien se dedica a la elaboración de delantales típicos y confección de blusas  típicas desde hace 7 años  inicio con la ayuda de su hermana ya que ella le enseño a utilizar maquinas industriales  para la elaboración de dicha prenda,  su negocio  lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio donde sus clientes la buscan por la tarde, y po las mañanas sale a vender en el parque de San Juan Sacatepéquez, el mayor deseo es seguir comprando mas materiales para variar colores y estilos en sus prendas,  de esa forma salir adelante con su única hija, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado
texts.en:
The Sajcavilla Duo

This group includes Deura, who has made traditional aprons and blouses for 7 years. She started with her sister's help, since she was the one who taught her to use industrial sewing machines to make this clothing. Her business is located in her home where her customers seek her out in the afternoon. In the mornings, she goes out to sell in the San Juan Sacatepéquez park. Her biggest wish is to keep buying materials to vary the color and style of her clothing. In this way, she gets ahead with her only daughter. She hopes that you can help her with the loan she has asked for.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Group 1 Liên Mạc

texts.en: Hê, second from the right in the front row, is a 38-year-old mother of two school-aged children. She earns about $33 (700,000 VND) a month working in the rice paddies. Although her family has never been able to afford a sanitary toilet, Hê has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1996 and participates in a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene. This loan will enable Hê to build a hygienic toilet that will improve her family's health and well being.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Group 4 At Lien Mac

texts.en: Huong, pictured first on the right, works in agricultural production and earns a monthly income of about $57 (1,200,000 VND). She is a 36-year-old mother of two; one child is still in school and one is grown. Her household does not currently have a hygienic toilet. Huong has been a member of the local Women’s Union for 23 years, and she is now involved in a community-wide health campaign to prevent common infections and diseases brought about by the use of unsafe toilets. Huong is requesting a loan to install a hygienic toilet in her home. This will improve the sanitary conditions and health of her family, and of her community as a whole.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Group 2 At Liên Mạc

texts.en: Thom, pictured in the first row at the far right, is 42-years-old and has two children currently in school. She and her husband are farm workers who also raise animals, earning a total of about $57 (1.2 million VND) monthly. A member of the local Women's Union since 1996, Thom recently joined their campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene practices. With this 10 million VND loan, she will have a sanitary toilet installed in her home, which will improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to improved sanitation in her community.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Hesti

texts.en:
Hesti lives in Cilegon, about two hours from Jakarta. Cilegon is known for the Krakatau city. Hesti manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. She is married.

Hesti joined Ruma three months ago because she wanted to improve her family’s income. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Hesti sees improvements in her shop. For the last three months, she has earned an average of $42 - $45 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en:
Cassien is aged 44; he is married and blessed with seven children. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Bielka

texts.en:
Bielka lives with her long-term partner and their three children in the city of Santiago. She has run her beauty salon business on her balcony for over four years, having started it with her own capital. Her latest loan was invested in the business. 

This is Bielka's fourth loan which she will use to finish building her house. Many years ago, Bielka started building her house, and with her business profits, she has been able to build her house little by little. Now Bielka wants to invest this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, tiles, concrete blocks, etc. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in repaying their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their businesses and attending their group meetings.

Bielka thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to you for your support!

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, tiles, concrete blocks, etc.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina de 44 años, está casada con Abdon y tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Delfina es una madre esmerada y responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 22 años. Junto a su esposo, ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones con esta actividad, “gracias  a la agricultura tengo mi casa y terrenos propios”, menciona. Ella se encarga de producir arvejas, maíz, papas, alfalfa y flores de gladiolos. Por la variedad de sus sembríos siempre está ocupada y siempre tiene ventas e ingresos para su familia y para ahorrar. Estos meses son cruciales para las siembras de todo tipo, ya que las lluvias empezaron. Delfina no se quiere quedar atrás, por eso solicita de su apoyo para sembrar arvejas, habas y papas, cuyas cosechas estarán listas para febrero del año próximo. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Delfina, invertirá los S/.3800 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Delfina is 44. She is married to Abdon and has a daughter whom she lives with in her own home. Delfina is a hardworking and responsible mother. She has worked in agriculture since she was 22. With her husband, she has obtained a lot of satisfaction with this activity. “Thanks to agriculture, I have my own house and land", she says. She grows peas, corn, potatoes, alfalfa and gladiolas. Because of the variety of crops she has she is always busy and she always has sales and income for her family and for saving. These months are crucial for all the crops, since the rains have started. Delfina doesn't want to be left behind. that is why she is asking for your help to plant peas, beans and potatoes. Their crops will be ready for February of next year. This is her fifth loan with Kiva. During this whole time, she has shown herself to be a responsible and committed person with her association. Delfina will invest the  S/.3,800 in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer. .

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 52 years old. He is a father of three children. He has spent 30 years in the farming business. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Group 3 At Liên Mạc

texts.en: Ly, first from the right in the front, is a 36-year-old farmer earning about $33 (700,000 VND) a month and supporting two school-age children. As a member of the Women's Union since 1998, she joined a campaign to install sanitary toilets in her community. Her family's toilet is severely damaged. With a loan of 10,000,000 VND, she will be able to replace it with a sanitary toilet to improve the hygiene and health of her whole family.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Group 12 At Lien Mac

texts.en: May, pictured first from the right, turned 52 this year. She works as a farmer and makes about $37 (800,000 VND) monthly. Married with five grown children, she has been a member of the Women's Union since 1980 and recently joined a campaign to improve sanitation and hygiene in her community. May's family does not have a sanitary toilet, but with this loan they will be able to install one, improving their health and quality of life by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Wati

texts.en:
Wati lives in Cilegon, about two hours from Jakarta. Cilegon is known for the Krakatau city. Wati manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  She is single.

Wati joined Ruma three months ago because she feels easier using Ruma’s product. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Wati sees improvements in her shop.  For the last three months, she has earned an average of $95 – $97 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Suyani

texts.en:
Suyani runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Suyani is married and living with four persons in the family home. 

Suyani began working with Ruma three months ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has had around $37 – $40 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials such as concrete blocks, cement, rods, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 38-year-old hotel owner. He is married to Kelly who produces additional income and together they are blessed with two children. Isaac has been running his hotel for the past three years with a monthly income of ksh25000 which he uses to provide for his family. 

Isaac is applying for his first loan term with Kiva partner KADET. He will use the loan to renovate and expand his hotel to hold more customers.  

With the expected profit from the business he will open another hotel in Mwingi town. 

Isaac hopes and dreams to open a five-star hotel in the future.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his hotel to hold more customers.

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Emma en su venta de mercancias pues con su creikiva logró aumentar sus inventarios y tambien sus ventas. La imagen de su negocio mejoró ya que contó con un capital y su inventario. Ella dice a sus finaciadores : " Gracias por el apoyo brindado y ojalá nos sigan apoyando. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancia variada como ropa, calzado, entre otros articulos que aumentarán sus ventas pues se acerca la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial, época en la cual tambien impacta positivamnete su economia doméstica,
texts.en: Thank you for supporting  Emma with her merchandise sales. With her Kiva loan she was able to increase her inventory and also her sales. Her business'; image improved, since she had capital and inventory. She says to her lenders "thank you for the support you have given and I hope you keep supporting us."  Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy varied merchandise such as clothes, shoes and other articles to increase her sales. The season with the most sales is coming, a time which will also positively impact her domestic budget.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise such as clothes, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a hardworking single mother of three children, aged 25, 22 and 20 years. She has been running a boutique shop, selling new and secondhand clothes for the last six years. 

The business brings in a monthly income of Kshs. 25,000 (Kenyan shillings). She is going to use the amount borrowed, Kshs. 70,000, to purchase more clothes for resale. 

She will use some of the anticipated profits from the boutique business to repay her loan and the remaining amount on sustaining her family. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ageda

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Ageda to improve her business.  She has a garden where many people come to purchase produce every day.  With her loan, she will buy some additional supplies such as seeds, vegetables, vegetable plants and equipment.  She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She enjoys running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Ageda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, vegetables, vegetable plants and equipment.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Narantsetseg, 52 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family resides in an old house on a plot of land.  She has been working as a watchman in a public apartment.  Her husband renders taxi service to the local community.  Their son has advanced to the third level in defense college.  She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay her son's tuition fees.  She and her husband think that the best thing they can do for their son is to invest in their son's education. Mrs. Narantsetseg is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
Neriza, aged 50, is married and has four adult children. One of her siblings works in Malaysia. She lives in Delapa, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. Neriza owns a parcel of rice field as one of her sources of income. Her husband earns income as a tricycle driver to sustain their daily needs. They earn a monthly income of 4500 PHP. 

Neriza has requested a new loan to pay for her sibling's plane ticket back to Malaysia. Neriza has been a CUMI member of Paglaum since 2006. She wishes that everything will be successful through prayer.

loans.use: to pay for her sibling's fare back to Malaysia

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a man of 53 years, married to Ann and a father of three children. He operates a medical clinic in Ikinu in the outskirt of Kiambu, he has been in this business for thirteen years and he gets monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be David's first loan with Kiva partner KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire amount to buy medical drugs for the business, he wants to offer better services to his customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy medical drugs.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 30 year old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband owns a general store in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He offers a variety of daily use products in the shop. His monthly net income is inadequate to meet the family needs.

Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of products to resell in the market at a profitable price. He would be purchasing greater variety of goods such as biscuits, ice cream, flour, candies, rice, bread etc. This will help him to increase his customers and to increase his net income as well.

With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sidra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, ice cream, flour, candies, rice, bread, etc.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. 

The financial condition of her family is not good because there is only one person who supports the entire through driving a rickshaw. Through this profession he generates only a small income. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shahida has applied for a loan for her husband as he wants to buy a new body for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. 

Shahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Nazia Group

texts.en:
Nazia is 30 years old, married and the mother of a son and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is part of a two-member group. She is an independent and hard working woman. For the last five years, she has been running a transport business. With her limited income,  she helps her husband to meet the family needs and her son's education costs. She is well aware of her business and, as a result, her clients always appreciate her work.

She has requested a loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a taxi to expand her business. Her biggest dream is to move forward so that she can lead a better life with dignity.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, concrete blocks, sand, rods, etc.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, age 28, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for the family. He is running this business successfully and all his customers appreciate his work.

He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery materials to resell. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

For that reason, his wife Salma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and embroidery materials like pearls, sequins, spools, and threads with the loan. Salma is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful for Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and embroidery materials.

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en: Mrs. Sarangerel, 42 years old, lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2004 and before that business, she had worked as a saleswoman at a grocery store.  Her elder daughter studies in drama college.  The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and loses heat through its walls and windows.  She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a low pressure heater and vacuum-insulated windows.  The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to state research center.  After installing a heater and windows, Mrs. Sarangerel's family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released.

loans.use: to buy a low pressure heater and vacuum-insulated windows.

loans.name: Maruush

texts.en:
Maruush, aged 44, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling casual clothes at an outdoor market since 2007 and, before this business, she ran an automobile repair workshop. Her husband works as an electrician at a private firm. Her daughter studies at university. 

Maruush is requesting a loan of 7,700,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate her house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the air. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to the National Research Center.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, aged 59, is married and is from Lawa-an, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. From her desire to help her family, she has operated a buy-and-sell business for the past two years from which she earns a living. 

Loreta enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 from the cooperative. This loan is intended to purchase construction/raw materials needed for her house renovation. The income from her business will be used to repay the loan. 

Loreta dreams of nothing more than to have a decent living, a happy and healthy life with her family, and an adequate income from her business. She deeply wishes to continue to be a member in good standing with PMPC and to repay her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy construction/raw materials for her house renovation

loans.name: Maria Armenia

texts.es: Armenia de 25 años casada, tiene dos hijas una de ellas ya estudia, su esposo trabaja independientemente, como piloto de camiones de rutas cortas. Doña Armenia se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, trajes, suéteres, pantalones, camisas, también vende uniformes para en tiempo escolar, desde hace 3 años vende en el mercado municipal de Santiago, ha logrado con sus ingresos, mejorar su vivienda y su economía. Ahora desea seguir invirtiendo en venta de ropa para dama ya que el precio es más alto desea invertir en eso. Agradece la oportunidad y está feliz por los logros obtenidos gracias a la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
Armenia, 25, is married and has two daughters, one of whom attends school.  Her husband works independently as a short-distance truck driver.

Armenia earns a living selling clothing for children: outfits, sweaters, pants, and shirts.  She also sells uniforms for the school year.  She has worked in the Santiago town market for three years, and has been able to improve her house and her finances with her income.

Now Armenia wants to continue investing in selling women's clothing, which gets a higher price.  She's grateful for the opportunity and happy about what she has achieved thanks to Kiva's help.

loans.use: to buy new clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 cylinders of gas directly from Managua to resell them at accessible prices in Waspam.

loans.name: Ariunzul

texts.en:
Ariunzul, aged 22, lives with her parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a Korean restaurant for two years during which she has managed to attract many customers by advertising online through public channels. As her customers increase, so does the food turnover. 

Therefore, Ariunzul is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to hire additional cooks and to purchase equipment. By doing so, she will be able to successfully run her restaurant.

loans.use: to hire additional cooks and to purchase equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Altanchimeg, aged 31, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling meat by renting a stall at the market since 2012. Her husband buys meat in large amounts from brokers at the wholesale price and takes responsibility for the supply of meat. 

The house in which they live has been deteriorating over the years so Altanchimeg is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to repair her house by buying building materials such as bricks, cements, planks and fiberglass. Less coal will need to be burned in the renovated house so less pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to repair and renovate her house

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 50-year-old widow, and the mother of four. She has been running a retail shop for the last 20 years, getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

With an eighth loan of KES 80,000 from KADET, Annah plans to restock her retail shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back to the business for expansion. 

Annah's dream is to successfully cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, aged 45, is married to Petrus, aged 49. They have three children: Ina, 26, a college student; Ronald, 19, who has just graduated from senior high school; and Reno, 8, who is in the second grade of elementary school. 

In order to meet her family's needs, Ester runs a business selling sandals. She started the business five years ago using her own capital. Sometimes, mostly in December, she also runs a business selling ornamental plants but this business depends on customers’ orders. 

Ester hopes to improve her sandal selling business by adding more stock of sandals in different sizes and patterns. Therefore, she requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent to purchase 25 score (500) pairs of sandals. She hopes that the business will have a good impact on her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sandals

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece Juan, con uno de sus hijos.

Juan de 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene 7 hijos de 2,5,8,13, 16, 18 y 20 años de edad; cuatro de ellos estudian y 2 trabajan, el mayor no vive con ellos. En la casa conviven 8 personas y todas dependen de Juan.

Juan tiene 10 años de trabajar como albañil, también es agricultor, ambos oficios los aprendió de su padre, con quien trabajo desde los 12 años de edad.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas para sembrar 7, 000 mts. Cuadrados de frijol y pagar la mano de obra requerida.
En un futuro Juan tiene pensado ampliar su vivienda, para que su amplia familia pueda vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Juan and one of his sons appear in the photo. Juan is 40 years old, married and has seven children, aged 2, 5, 8, 13, 16, 18 and 20 years old. Four of them go to school and the oldest one no longer lives with them. Eight of them live together in their house and they all depend on Juan. Juan has been working as a bricklayer for 10 years. He also is a farmer. He learned both of these trades from his father, who he worked with since he was 12 years old.

Juan will use the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides to plant 7,000 square meters of beans and to pay for the labor required. In the future Juan wants to expand his house so his large family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides to plant 7,000 square meters of beans and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 25 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo en la casa que alquila desde hace 2 años. Desde hace 10 años comenzó en este negocio de la agricultura, afirma ser una persona muy responsable y desde muy joven aprendió de su padre a ser emprendedora, es así que gracias a los toros que compró, puede arar la tierra y así minimizar gastos. Cuando formó su familia y gracias a su esposo pudo comercializar sus alimentos a la ciudad de Lima, capital del país, cuando la cosecha es poca solo lo comercializa a la ciudad de Tarma, donde ella reside. Hace poco compraron junto a su esposo un auto con el que trabaja en el trasporte público, espera poder seguir mejorando sus sembríos de papa, alverja y maíz, para poder seguir ahorrando pues su próximo objetivo es construir su propia casa. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues así lo demostró en otros préstamos iguales. Ruth, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Ruth, 25, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and her young child in the house she has rented for two years.

Ruth has worked in agriculture for 10 years.  She says she's a very responsible person who learned to be enterprising from her father when she was very young.  Thanks to the bulls she bought she can plow the land and minimize her expenses.  When she started her family, thanks to her husband she was able to sell her food in the city of Lima, the capital of the country.  When the harvest is small she sells only in Tarma, where she lives.  Not long ago she and her husband bought a car, with which he works in public transportation.

Ruth hopes to continue improving her potato, pea, and corn plants so she can keep on saving money, because her next goal is to build her own house.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the support she's getting and promises to make her payments punctually, as she has done with similar loans.

Ruth will invest the 2000 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Narlina

texts.en:
This is Narlina.  She sells different products mostly for household use.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more products for her retail store.  The income from her business assisted in the education of her children. She and her husband are working to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies such as a dust pan, mirror, hanger, pliers and other products needed for her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in better profits.  Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narlina dreams to have an additional stall for her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies such as a dust pan, mirror, hanger, pliers and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is 41 years old, married and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy tires for a tractor trolley for her husband. Her husband provides a loading and unloading service for construction materials such as sand, soil, and bricks for builders. Due to continuously working, the tires of the tractor trolley have been wearing out and not picking up the load or the tires are punctured.

Therefore, Riffat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy new tires for the tractor trolley. She wants her husband to carry on this business because this is the only source of income for her family. She has some savings but it is insufficient to buy a new trolley so she requested a loan.

Riffat is very thankful for Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new tires for a tractor trolly.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 40 years old; he is married with five children. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; they need to buy fertilizer to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance, in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market, and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma belongs with to an ultra poor family, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband has been providing services making iron doors, windows, and fixing broken accessories with the help of welding plant (arc welder).

Few days ago his welding plant malfunctioned due to overheating, and he wants to buy a new welding plant. He does not have money, due to lack of savings.

Therefore, Asma requested a loan from BRAC, who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.  

Asma says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Mirembe Women Group

texts.en:
Mirembe Women’s Group is located along a busy street of Kyotera town. Its members are business people within the town.

Joan is a mother of five between the ages of 9 and 18; three go to school. She is a very hard-working lady. 36-year-old Joan is a hairdresser who works four days a week and ten hours per day.

Joan started this business in 2003 after she realized how profitable it was. She rears pigs as a supplementary source of income. 

Joan is going to use the loan to buy cosmetics and other equipment needed in the hair-dressing business.

The major challenge faced with her business is the constant debt of some of her customers.

Joan’s dream is to own a super market within the same town, because she feels that's when she will make a lot more income, since there is a high demand for those goods.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and dryers

loans.name: Ressy

texts.en:
Ressy lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 26 years and she is a single business lady. 

She started her clothes business six months ago, and the business is growing. She learned of Milango through friends who invited her to join; they can save and be able to access credit to fund their businesses. 

She has a long-term vision of opening a salon in five years. She now seeks a loan to buy two bales of second-hand clothes for her business. 

The challenge in the business is competition and the fluctuation in prices. She will use the income raised to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy two bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Xayyam

texts.en:
Xayyam is 33 years old and married, and he has one son.  Xayyam lives with his family in a city.  His parents also live with him because they are old and ill; because of that, he is taking care of his parents, too. He is a very positive man. 

Xayyam is a market vendor.  He sells food products, like cakes, rice, and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 10 years. He started it with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field because he needed to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. 

He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.  He is now requesting AZN 2,000. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar, and vegetables for his store. 

He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. Xayyam has a good loan history. This is his fifth loan.  He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client.

loans.use: to buy food products for his store

loans.name: Verónica Etelvina

texts.es:
Verónica de 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, esta embarazada, estudio hasta bachillerato. En su casa convive con sus padres, la cuñada y el hermano menor.

Verónica desde pequeña trabaja con su padre en la siembra de Maíz, con él a aprendido todo lo que sabe, trabaja en un restaurante que le queda a 900 mts de su casa, su horario es de 6 de la mañana a 11 de la mañana y por su situación en estos momento esta en reposo. 

El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de Maíz que tiene establecido y así lo trabajen sus hermanos.

Por lo pronto, lo que mas desea Verónica es ser madre, darle a su hijo el estudio y las comodidades que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Verónica, 20 years old, is single and has no children. She is pregnant, and completed a high school diploma. She lives in a house with her parents, her sister-in-law, and her younger brother. 

Since she was little, Verónica has worked with her father growing corn. With him, she learned everything she knows. She works at a restaurant that is 900 meters from her home. Her schedule is from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m. but because of her situation, she is on leave at the moment.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for the corn cultivation that is already established and that she works on together with her siblings.

What Verónica wants most is to be a mother, and give her child the schooling and the luxuries that she was not able to have.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for corn cultivation

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, a 26-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and son, is very hard-working. She wishes to uplift her family from poverty, thus she is working so hard to provide for the needs of her son. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi, which he has been running for five years. She supports her husband, and looks to satisfy the needs of her family. 

She hopes, with the help of this loan, she will reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future.

loans.use: To pay to repair their taxi.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a student of the American University of Central Asia, and she studies in the department of economics.  Here is her story.

"I studied at physics – mathematics school-lyceum No61 and was always interested in mathematics. In senior classes, we started having lessons in economics which were very interesting, especially the role of mathematics in economics. That is why I decided to continue developing my interests and enroll in the economics department.  Also, my choice was influenced by the fact that economics is an integral part of daily life. A person deals with economy when they think how much money they have to save for a new purchase, how much they have to pay for repairs, how the inflation influences their salary, how to save money etc.  Economy also helps to answer the issues in the sphere of entrepreneurship and economic activity, how to determine what it means to increase the net profit and to provide employees with satisfactory salary, how the relations with foreign partners influence activities, and supply and demand at the market. The knowledge of economy allows me to follow and understand the situations in the world. Today our country is in need of competent specialists in different areas.  The economy of our country is unstable and I would like to help Kyrgyzstan. Our country has a great potential. I have a possibility to make an effort to improve the economic situation of our country.
The American University in Central Asia is one of the leading universities in Kyrgyzstan, keeping up with the times, and its graduates are recognized with employment. AUCA is a basic step for many successful people. In Kyrgyzstan, you can meet graduates of AUCA who can perform their duties at an excellent level. I would also like to take an active role in the social life of AUCA. 
AUCA is the place that I always was looking for, the place where I wanted to be and I am happy that my dream came true."
  
At the same time, Nelly wonders about the financial part of this issue, as her family cannot afford paying the tuition fees. But she doesn’t want money to stop her from her studies. A Kiva loan would let Nelly be more concentrated on her studies, not on thinking about how to earn money for her tuition. The American University of Central Asia has been the university of her dreams for years and she doesn’t want financial restrictions to be a barrier for her future success.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 31-year old mother of four children.  Three of her children go to school. 
She owns a tailoring business at home and sews cloths for the ladies of her hometown. Her husband is employed in a factory but he earns insufficient income. She started her tailoring business as per the needs of her family. She uses a local sewing machine which works manually and very slowly.  Due to Eid ul Azha, she has lot of pending work for completion but without a speedy machine it seems impossible to sew cloths before Eid.
Therefore, Nargis requested a loan to buy a Juki sewing machine so that she could sew cloths by a specific time. She expects that with the help of a new machine she can complete her tasks in very short time.  In this way, she could spend more time with her family and could generate income as well.
Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Al-Yousfy Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Yousfy, and consists of four female members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Huda is a 36-year-old married woman; she has seven children and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She sold her jewels to build her house. 

She lives with her children in a bad situation; her husband's income isn't enough to cover what his family needs. She would like remodel her house, so she needs a loan to buy building materials such as cement and lumber. 

She is grateful for the loan, and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and lumber to remodel her house.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 26-year-old married woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Abida is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 65 years old and supporting a family of two people.

Stephen owns rental houses.  He has been in this business for the past 16 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000.  

Stephen has qualified to get his fifth loan from KADET LTD of KES 50,000, with which he plans to renovate his rental houses and also buy a water tank. With the anticipated profit, Stephen will build more rental houses.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to support his family.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Maarif

texts.en:
Maarif is 47, married, and he has five kids, two sons and three daughters. He earns a living by breeding cows and cattle, and sells their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. He has 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Maarif  usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a profitable price to butchers. Milk and yogurt he sells to neighbors. He earns about 180 AZN a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt. Milk products are seen as very healthy and used daily. 

Because his family has only one source of income, Maarif is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy three cattle and two milk cows. 

This will be his second loan. He has a good client history, and plans to use the additional income he earns to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and two milk cows.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru: Джамолиддин жизнерадостный человек. Ему 32 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Джамолиддин уже более 11 лет занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Он замечательно справляется с бизнесом. Его жена Мачигул помогает ему по введению бизнеса. Джамолиддин очень заботливый отец. Он всегда старается, чтобы его дети росли в достатке. Джамолиддин хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Это его второй займ. Первый займ он использовал для развития своего бизнеса и погасил своевременно. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jamoliddin is a 32-year-old with a cheerful disposition, a wife, and 2 kids.  He is a caring father to his children, and always tries his best to ensure they have everything they need.  By trade, he is a livestock farmer; for the past 11 years, he has been buying livestock, then selling them at a local market after fattening them for a few months.  He is very good at what he does.  His wife Machigul also helps him with his business.      

Jamoliddin wishes to increase the working capital of his business, which would increase his income in turn.  This would be his second loan; he used the first one to grow his business, and paid it off in a timely manner.  He is requesting a loan of $2200 (USD) to buy more livestock, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy livestock to increase his working capital

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
