I am applying for the loan as well, as I have financial difficulties and am not able to cover my tuition fees fully.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en: Mirza is 20 years old and lives with his parents in Imishli. He couldn’t get a higher education and because of that, he decided to start his own business as a farmer. He is growing fruits and vegetables on his own land with help from his brother. Mirza wants to expand his business. The amount of produce he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to grow more fruits and vegetables to increase his turnover as well as improve the living conditions of his family. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,800 AZN loan. This will be his second loan and Mirza  has a good client history.

loans.use: to increase his turnover of produce as well as improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Epifaneo

texts.es:
Epifaneo, de 67 años es viudo. Hace muchos años su esposa falleció y por ello no pudo tener hijos. Él vive en una casa propia, que construyó con mucho esfuerzo en un anexo agrícola. Él es un hombre de mucha fuerza. Su edad no es impedimento para dedicarse a la agricultura. Una actividad muy cansada para muchos, pero para éste hombre es más que una fuente de ingresos, ya que toda su vida la pasa en el campo. Sus principales cultivos constan de papas, arvejas, flores de gladiolos y habas. Pero manifiesta que le conviene sembrar arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por la rapidez en su crecimiento y por la poca inversión. Casi siempre trabaja solo. Por eso cuenta con caballos y burros que le ayudan para trasladar sus cosechas. En ocasiones, en el caso de las cosechas tiene que recurrir a contratar personal. Él espera continuar con su actividad, por que le agrada lo que hace, por eso esta vez iniciará una siembra de arvejas y habas, para ello solicita de su apoyo.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Epifaneo, invertirá los S/.4500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Sixty-seven-year-old Epifaneo is a widower.  His wife died many years ago, which is why he was not able to have children.  He lives in his own home, which he built with a lot of effort in a farming annex.  He is a very strong man.  His age is no impediment to his work in farming.  This work is tiring for many people, but for this man it is a source of income, as he has spent his whole life in the field.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, gladiolus flowers, and broad beans.  The easiest crops to plant are the peas and the gladiolus flowers because they grow fast and require little investment.  He almost always works alone.  Because of this, he has horses and donkeys to help him transport his harvests.  Sometimes during the harvest season he has to hire help.  He hopes to continue with his work because he likes what he does.  This time he will start a planting of peas and broad beans, which is why he is asking for help.  

This is his third loan with Kiva and throughout this entire time he has proven himself to be a responsible person who is committed to his communal bank.  Epifaneo will invest the 4,500 soles in organic fertilizer to treat his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is 44 years old, married, and blessed with three children who are still in school. Gulnara is a hardworking woman. She has been sewing women's clothing for more than four years. Her elder daughter is also helping her mother in this business. She sews beautifully and carefully, and tries to make her clients happy. Gulnara's husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough to solve the problems of their family. She has been planning for several years to repair her home but doesn't have money to purchase building materials like cement, wood, paint, and so on. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 AZN. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to repair her home

loans.name: Mari

texts.es: Mari, de 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Todos ellos viven en la casa que compró hace algunos años en su localidad. Mari es una mujer de principios y de actitud luchadora para el trabajo. Desde los 17 años trabaja como agricultora en terrenos que heredó de sus padres. En ellos produce arvejas, habas, papas, maíz y flores de diversos colores. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, a mi esposo también, los 2 nos dividimos las tareas”, menciona. Además dice que, la venta de arvejas estos días es  buena porque el precio del saco subió. Con ese dinero podrá comprar más semillas de otros productos, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Mari ya empezó con la siembra de papas, por eso también se esmerará en sus cuidados. Su meta para este año se enfoca en adquirir más semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar arvejas y papas. Por eso requiere de se apoyo. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Mari, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus cultivos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Mari, 38, is married with two children. Everyone lives together in the house she bought some time ago in her community.  Mari’s a principled woman with a positive attitude towards work.  She’s worked since the age of 17 on land she inherited from her parents growing peas, lima beans, potatoes, corn and various colored flowers.  “I like working in the fields and so does my husband; both of us share the chores,” she mentions.  She also says that pea sales are good now because the price per sack rose.

She will use that money to buy more seeds for other products because the rainy season has begun and she wants to take maximum advantage of it.  Mari has already started planting potatoes so she’ll also intensify her efforts caring for them too.  

Her goal for this year is focused on acquiring more seed and fertilizer to plant peas and potatoes which is why she needs your support.  This is her 5th Kiva loan and she’s been responsible and committed to her association all this time.  Mari will use the 3,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured here), age 49, works for a flower farm.  She has been married since 1987 and has three children. She lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a driver for a company.
Phalla is applying for a loan of $1,500 to build an additional room in the house where she lives.

loans.use: to build an additional room in the house where she lives.

loans.name: Reydo

texts.es: Reydo, de 44 años está casado con Ana y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Él es un hombre noble y sociable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño. Manifiesta que ayudaba a sus padres en los cultivos de sus terrenos, desde entonces le agradó esa actividad. Por eso ahora, se encarga de cuidar sus sembríos de papas, maíz, arvejas y flores de gladiolos. Trabaja contento en el campo, al lado de su esposa. Además cuenta con animales de carga que le sirven mucho para su actividad. “Éste mes estoy recogiendo las flores de gladiolos, y los precios son buenos, por las fiestas religiosas”, cuenta. En sus planes está empezar 2 siembras, una de arvejas y otra de maíz, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Solicita de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Reydo, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Reydo is 44 years old, is married to Ana, and has three children who live with him in a house he owns. He is a noble and sociable man. He has made a living from agriculture from the time he was young. He states that he helped his parents with the cultivation of their lands; he has liked this business since then. He is therefore now responsible for caring for his crops of potatoes, corn, peas and gladiola flowers.

He works happily in the countryside alongside his wife. He also has pack animals that are a lot of use to him in his business. “This month I'm picking the gladiola flowers, and the prices are good because of the religious festivals,” he says. His plans include starting two crops, one of peas and another of corn, as the rains have begun and he wants to take full advantage of them. He is asking for your support to achieve his objectives. 

This is his fifth loan with Kiva, and in all of this time he as shown himself to be a responsible person who is committed to his association. Reydo will invest the 3,500 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nurture his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 37 años está casada con Héctor, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Todos ellos viven en la casa que construyeron con esfuerzo desde hace 8 años y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Mercedes es una madre trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad es la agricultura. No es fácil su labor y más aún con una pequeña hija, pero Mercedes es admirable, y se esfuerza en la tierra. Gracias a esa dedicación ahora cuenta con terrenos de cultivos propios. Por ello siembra papas y arvejas, en mayor cantidad, pero también cultiva maíz, habas y flores de gladiolos pero no es seguido. Además cuenta con 2 toros para el arado y 2 burros para la carga de sus cosechas. Ella y su esposo están muy contentos y felices, puesto que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura, ya que le genera dinero cada cosecha. Por ello está convencida de progresar mediante sus cultivos y, de ese modo ahorrar para adquirir más terrenos y evitar pagar el derecho de alquiler. Sus planes más próximos son sembrar arvejas y papas, para ello solicita otra vez de su apoyo. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Mercedes, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 37 years old and married to Héctor, with whom she has three children. They all live in the house they built with effort eight years ago, which is located in an agricultural zone. Mercedes is a hard-working and responsible mother. Her business is agriculture. 

Her work is not easy and less so with her small daughter, but Mercedes is admirable and she strives to work the land. Thanks to this dedication she now owns her own land that she cultivates. On this land she plants large quantities of potatoes and peas, but she also cultivates corn, lima beans and gladiola flowers periodically. In addition, she has two bulls for the plow and two donkeys to carry her harvests. 

She and her husband are very content and happy, as they like to work in agriculture because it generates money at each harvest. She therefore believes in making progress through her crops, thus saving money to acquire more land and avoiding having to pay rental fees. Her immediate plans are to plant peas and potatoes; this is why she is asking for your support once again.

This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead. She also commits to making her payment in a punctual manner. Mercedes will invest the 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to scatter among her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sériba

texts.fr:
Né en Octobre 1960 à Tinzanadougou préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Sériba est marié et père de 7 enfants, il réside avec ses deux épouses et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Sériba  après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente de bétail il y’a environ 9 ans. Il mène cette activité au marché de bétail à Sikasso où il vend des  (moutons, chèvres, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son bétail. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a environs trois ans, il est à son quatrième prêt individuel.
Ce quatrième  prêt servira à acheter 50 ovins dans les localités environnantes qui sont entre autres (Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.)
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in October 1960 in Tinzanadougou, Préfecture de Sikasso, Mr. Sériba is a married father of seven children. He resides with his two spouses and their children in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, Mr. Sériba became familiar with the business of buying and selling livestock about nine years ago. He operates this business at the livestock market in Sikasso, where he sells sheep, goats, etc. He is much in demand by customers for the quality of his animals. 

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago and is now on his fourth individual loan. This fourth loan will be used to purchase 50 head of sheep from surrounding towns, including Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses, repay the loan interest, and invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to trade

loans.name: Djenebou

texts.fr:
Née en Janvier 1980 à Sikasso, Madame Djenebou est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye Zantiguibougou un des quartiers péripherique de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Cette femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités de vente de pagnes wax et des ustensiles de cuisine il y a environ 11 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un  an. Après des prêts solidares (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 7 complets de tissus brodés et 5 colis de tasses à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et qui seront vendus à Sikasso de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born in January 1980 in Sikasso, Ms. Djenebou is a married mother of four. She resides with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye Zantiguibougou, a suburb of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, this woman became familiar with the business of buying and selling Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and kitchen utensils about eleven years ago.

Concerned about better satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. After solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her district, she is now on her first individual loan. This initial loan will enable her to purchase 10 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth, 7 outfits of embroidered fabrics, and 5 packages of basins in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). These goods will be sold door to door to a customer base composed essentially of women in Sikasso.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase her working capital, help cover family expenses, and pay back the loan interest.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth, embroidered fabrics, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Abboud

texts.en:
Abboud is a 19-year-old single man who has had a mobile-phone shop since 2011. He also sells prepaid cards and new released mobiles accessories; he is also specialized in making necessary technical maintenance.

At the beginning he had difficulties in expanding his work, because of the wide competition around him. Abboud proved to be skillful, with a special customer service that strengthens his position among others.

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his mobile phones capital through buying new released items to reply better to his customers' needs.

As for the future, Abboud is hoping to expand his working place through moving to a wider one, and diversifying his products to attract new customers. He would also like to open a separate maintenance department.

loans.use: to increase his mobile phones capital through buying new released items to reply better to his customers' needs.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Alfonso con quien tiene 3 hijos de 14, 9 y 5 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Clorinda es una madre tierna y una esposa responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 22 años. Por eso confía en su desempeño como mujer de campo. Sus principales cultivos constan de arvejas, habas, cebada, maíz y flores de gladiolos. “En mi zona hay buenos terrenos, por eso crece de todo”, dice. Con el apoyo de su pareja, pueden cubrir todo el trabajo que requiere el campo; pero muchas veces no es suficiente, por eso contratan más personal. Casi toda su producción la negocian en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “Las arvejas, habas y maíz, se venden ahí y casi al instante, pero las flores de gladiolos las llevo para otra feria”, menciona sobre su trabajo. Ahora espera volver a sembrar arvejas y habas, aprovechando las lluvias que empiezan a caer en este mes, por ello requiere de su apoyo financiero. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Clorinda, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Clorinda, who is 48 years old, is married to Alfonso, with whom she has three children who are 14, 9, and 5 years old.  They all live in their own home.  Clorinda is a caring mother and a responsible wife.  She has been working in farming since she was 22 years old.  For this reason, she is confident in her skills as a woman working the fields.  Her main crops are peas, broad beans, barley, corn, and gladiolus flowers.  "The land is good where I live, which is why everything grows," she tells us.  With her partner's support, they are able to cover all the work the land requires; but many times it is not enough and they have to hire help.  She sells almost all of her produce at the wholesale market in Tarma.  "I sell the peas, broad beans, and corn there almost instantly, but I take the gladiolus flowers to a different market," she tells us of her work.  Currently, she plants to plant more peas and broad beans, taking advantage of the rains that are starting to fall this month.  To do this she needs your financial support.  This is her fifth loan with Kiva and during this entire time she has proven to be a responsible person who is dedicated to her communal bank.  Clorinda will invest her 3,000 soles in organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est âgée de 50 ans, mariée et père de 5 enfants, il réside avec son épouse et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerema Zone, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de couture il y’ a 24 années. Son atelier de couture se trouve à Wayerema Zone où il dispose déjà de 6 machines dont 3 machines de broderie et 3 machines simples. Monsieur Yacouba est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso environs quelques années. Il sollicite ce troisième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter 1 machine de broderie, 2 machines simples et des tissus pour en coudre et ensuite les revendre afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba is 50 years old, married, and the father of five. He resides with his wife and his children in a large traditional extended family in Wayerema Zone, a suburb of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Mr. Yacouba became familiar with the business of sewing about 24 years ago. His sewing workshop is found in Wayerema Zone, where he already has six machines, that is, three for embroidering and three basic ones. He is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his services. 

Concerned about better satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few years ago. He is requesting this third individual loan to enable him to purchase an embroidering machine, two basic machines, and some fabrics to sew and then resell in order to meet ever-growing customer demands.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses, pay back the loan interest, and invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new embroidering machine and some fabrics

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past four years, Zaki has been working in a barber shop he owns. He took this experience from his previous job. Zaki likes his job and tries to always improve it. 

Zaki took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy furniture and make new decorations for his barber shop. This will improve his business conditions and attract more customers. 

Zaki appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy furniture and make new decorations for his barber shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años es una mujer noble. Enviudó hace 4 años, desde entonces cuidó de sus 4 hijos aunque ahora solo vive con 2 de ellos en la casa que compró hace 20 años.  “Mi trabajo es sembrar y criar animales, desde que mi esposo murió estas son mis principales ingresos económicos”, afirma. Su vida se centra en el trabajo duro, a pesar de sus necesidades siempre brindó una buena educación a sus hijos, siendo estos profesionales. Posee 7 vacas lecheras de las cuales extrae un promedio de 48 litros de leche diariamente, los cuales comercializa a una distribuidora de leche. Asimismo siembra papa, maíz en diversos terrenos agrícolas de su localidad, que son propios. Ahora ella desea mejorar la producción de leche de sus animales. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. María, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 48, is a noble woman.  She was widowed four years ago and since then has cared for her four children even though only two of them still live with her in the house she bought 20 years ago.  “My work is planting crops and caring for animals.  Since my husband died these are my main sources of income,” she affirms.

Her life is centered on hard work.  Despite her needs she always provided good education for her children and they are now professionals.  She owns 7 dairy cows that produce on average 48 liters of milk daily that she sells to a milk distributor.  She also grows potatoes and corn on various parcels of farmland she owns in her community.

Now, she’d like to improve her cows’ milk production.  This is her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for this progress opportunity and promises to be punctual with her payments.  María will use the 2,000 soles to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia de 29 años de edad  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 10 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Claudia is 29 years old and has a store where she sells everyday items such as beans, milk, eggs and bread. She has been running her business out of her home for ten years, and has gained a lot of sales experience which helps her to obtain the highest profits. Claudia says that her store is well-known in the neighborhood, and that she has many customers because her store is well-stocked. Claudia lives with her husband and two children in their own home, and she uses the income she earns to cover the household expenses. 

Claudia says that she wants to invest to expand her business, and she is requesting this loan to buy what she needs for her store. She promises to pay back the loan, and she is confident that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, snacks, milk, eggs, bread, soft drinks and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, baking pans, etc.

loans.name: Hector Dionicio

texts.es: Héctor de 55 años de edad  tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Hector is 55 years old, he owns a small grocery store where he sells perishable goods such as beverages, candy, sweets, and various edible and non-edible products. Thanks to this business he has supported his family, and he owns a house where he lives with his wife and his 4 children. 

He is trying to improve their quality of life, and for this reason he is requesting a loan to have a larger variety of goods in his store, for instance: dry grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc. This will increase business profits and enhance life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, soft drinks, candy, oil, dry soups, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 1 año, comercializa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su familia, la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y seguir con su negocio que es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder  ayudando en su casa en los gastos que se les presentan y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This client has been selling clothing and shoes for a year now.  She sells on foot in different markets close to her home.  She lives in her own home with her family.  She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale and to be able to keep her business going, as it is her only source of work.  This will help her with the household expenses that come up and will give her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Edin Ovando

texts.es: Edin de 41 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, Edin esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Edin, 41, has worked in agriculture for two years so has acquired skills needed to care for his crops.  His main crops are beans and corn that he sells to basic grain agencies near his place of residence.  He uses profits from these sales to cover some of his family’s expenses.  He lives with his wife and children.

Edin’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like seed, fertilizer, manure, etc. that will help with his crops to earn higher profits and continue helping with his household expenses with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Moneeb

texts.en: Moneeb is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and his five children, three sons and two daughters, in a humble house. Moneeb is an employee in the public sector where he earns a very low income. Moneeb would like to improve his living conditions and buy everything his household needs. Moneeb took a  2,612.16 USD Murabah loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. It is very necessary since the water in his area is not clean. Moneeb would like to take another loan in the future and open his own business . Moneeb appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Consuelo pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, plátanos, yuca  y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Consuelo, 60, lives with her husband in her own house.  She works making and selling fast-food snacks like fried potatoes, fried cassava, etc. from place to place near her place of residence.  Thanks to her sales she’s able to cover household expenses.  Consuelo’s asking for financing to buy the ingredients and supplies like oil, potatoes, bananas and cassava she uses to make the snacks to continue supporting her home and being able to cover any expenses that might arise.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, bananas and cassava.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and his five children, three sons and two daughters, in a humble house. Murad is an employee in a local restaurant where he earns a very low income. Murad would like to improve his living conditions and buy everything his household needs. Murad took a 1,244.27 USD Murabah loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his home. It is very necessary since the water in his area is not clean. Murad would like to take another loan in the future and open his own business. Murad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es: Medardo de 65 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y su hijo; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola,  comercializa sus productos en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, Medardo es una hombre dedicado a su labor, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  para obtener mejores ganancias y así podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Medardo is 65 years old and lives with his wife and son. He makes a living from agriculture, specifically from the cultivation of corn and beans. He has been working in this business for many years, and it has been a very valuable experience, allowing him to obtain the best harvests. The land he cultivates is located in an area where agriculture is common. He sells his products in all of the surrounding areas and he already has an established clientele. These people always prefer his product because it is good quality and sold at truly affordable prices. The service is also unmatched.

Medardo is a man who is dedicated to his work; he needs to invest in supplies but he needs capital. He is therefore asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc., in order to obtain greater earnings and thus be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo de 55 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Amparo, 55, lives with her family in her own house.  She has had a food stand near her place of residence for 7 years and uses profits earned from it to cover her household expenses. 

She’s a hardworking woman who strives to give her best so that her family will lack nothing needed to subsist. She has the satisfaction of having a regular clientele because she’s located in a very busy spot.

She wants to expand her stand, that is, to buy tables, chairs and more raw materials like rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary her menu and earn a bit more income but lacks sufficient income for this investment which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy the aforesaid and earn higher profits to attain better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and raw materials.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Juana Bautista de 50 años de edad, soltera y del domicilio de Chinandega en el occidente del país, se dedica la venta de mercadería en general, ella comercializa ropa nueva, cosméticos, y calzados realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante y en centros de trabajos los días de pago, los cuales los ofrece al credito y al contado ella no maneja productos en su hogar debido a que trabaja por medio de pedidos y ciertos que los coloca e dos dos o tres dias lo mas esos productos y todo lo maneja en cuentas por cobrar los que recupera semanal y quincenal. Juana tiene 19 años de tener este negocio el cual le ha ayudado a salir adelante, es una mujer responsable, honesta, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. desde muy temprana edad se dedica a este negocio como un medio digno de vivir y asi apoyar en los gastos economicos en su hogar. uno de sus sueños es el de mejorar su vivienda e incrementar mas su negocio porque su demanda ha crecido mas.  Ella solicita crédito para compra de capital de trabajo con el cual comprara más ropa con nuevos estilos y colores pedidos por la demanda, lo cual le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana Bautista, 50, is single living in Chinandega in the western part of the country.  She works selling general merchandise like new clothes, cosmetics and shoes.  She sells them from place to place and at various workplaces on payday.  She sells on credit and for cash.  She does not sell from home because she works based on prior, sure orders that she delivers in two or three day at the most and collects payments every week or every two weeks.  

Juana has been in business 19 years and it’s helped her to get ahead.  She’s a responsible, honest, hardworking woman who very much wants to improve.  She’s been working in this business since a very young age as a way of earning a living and cover household expenses with dignity.

One of her dreams is to improve her home and increase her business because demand has increased.  She’s asking for the loan to buy working capital: more clothes in newer styles and colors that she has orders for because of the higher demand.  This will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  Sra. Mirian del Socorro, originaria de Nagarote, madre soltera con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos,  no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de superación personal Miriam tiene por actividad económica una tienda de mercadería en general como ropa cosméticos, productos de bazar, hilos, cintas, bisuterías. Panales, ropa de bebe, adornos para el cabello. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en  su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Miriam agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mirian del Socorro was born in Nagarote and is a single mother caring for her children. She is hardworking and responsible and wants to succeed. She enjoys her children's company in her free time. Sadly, she lacked the money to go to college and started to work at an early age to help pay household expenses.

With effort and the desire to succeed, Miriam runs a store, where she sells merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, thread, ribbon, costume jewelry, diapers, baby clothing, and hair accessories. Her business is in her house, and she works 12 hours a day selling her merchandise so that she can earn more income. Miriam thanks Kiva lenders, who offer low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua the chance for decent work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, thread, ribbon, costume jewelry, diapers, baby clothing, and hair accessories for her business.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur  s’appelle Ablaye ; il est âgé de 30 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Ablaye s’active dans le commerce depuis 2003. Il a ouvert un magasin dans la gare routière où il vend des téléviseurs, des radios, des dvd, des portables. Il est un habitué de l’IMCEC car il est à son neuvième crédit.  Il faisait recours à l’IMCEC à chaque fois qu’il avait besoin de renforcer son capital. Ablaye travaille de 8h à 22h et gère lui-même son activité. Il possède une clientèle qu’il a fidélisée grâce au stock permanent qu’il détient dans sa boutique.
Ablaye s’occupe de nourrir sa famille et de l’entretenir. Et grâce aux bénéfices que rapporte l’activité, il peut épargner et penser ouvrir dans l’avenir un autre magasin pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
This borrower is called Ablaye; he is 30 years old, married, and a father of four. Ablaye has been active in commerce since 2003. He opened a store in a bus station, where he sells TV sets, radios, DVD's, and mobile phones. He is a regular at the microfinance institution IMCEC, since he is on his ninth loan. He has turned to IMCEC whenever he needs to bolster his capital. 

Ablaye works from 8 AM to 10 PM running his business by himself. He possesses a customer base whose loyalty he has earned by his constant inventory of goods he maintains in his store. 

Ablaye is responsible for his family's food and care. And thanks to the profits his business brings in, he can save money and think about opening another store in the future in order to maximize his profit.

loans.use: to purchase TV sets, radios, DVDs, and mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria Elizabeth es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque, tiene 26 años de edad y desde hace tres años posee una zapatería. En su zapatería ofrece a sus clientas muchos estilos de sandalias, zapatos de vestir, y zapatos de niñas y niños. En la localidad la visitan muchas personas, ya que vende zapatos de muy buena calidad. Está muy contenta porque gracias a su negocio ha salido adelante. Junto a su esposo luchan por salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su pequeña niña de tan solo 3 añitos. Doña Gloria ha sido bien responsable en su crédito anterior. El sueño de Gloria Elizabeth es surtir más tu zapatería, ofrecer un mejor estilo a sus clientes y siempre atender muy bien para que sus clientas estén satisfechos.
texts.en:
Gloria Elizabeth is from the San Martín Jilotepeque area.   She’s 26-years-old and for the last three years has owned a shoe store where she offers her customers many styles of sandals, dress shoes and children’s shoes.  Many people visit her shop because she sells very good quality shoes.  

She’s very happy because thanks to her business she’s gotten ahead.  She and her husband strive to get ahead and provide the best for their 3-year-old daughter.

Gloria was very responsible with her previous loan.  Her dream is to better stock her shoe store, to offer her customers better styles and always provide good customer service so that her customers will leave satisfied.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира жизнерадостная женщина. Она любимая мать 4 детей. Шоира замужем за доброго человека. Она имеет медицинское образование. Шоира работает в местной поликлинике медсестрой. Ее зарплата маленькая и не хватает для обеспечения детей. Шоира с целью получения дополнительного дохода 4 года назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Она имеет в обороте 2 голов коровы. Шоира хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shoira is a cheerful woman. She is the loving mother of four children. Shoira is married to a good man. She has a medical education. Shoira works in a local clinic as a nurse. Her salary is small and is not enough to support the children. 

Four years ago with the goal of receiving additional income, Shoira started her own business raising livestock. She has two heads of cattle in circulation. Shoira wants to increase her working capital and in this way to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is hard-working and responsible spouse and father to his six children. He and his spouse work together to earn a living. 

Felipe manages his livestock and farming business, while his spouse owns a retail store. The couple has been thankful to our Almighty God because through their hard work and initiative, they are able to increase their profits. 

Felipe would like to secure his hogs with proper nutrition upon reaching their optimum growth. With his determination to have a continuous smooth flow of his livestock and farming business, he is requesting additional capital of PHP 40,000. He will use this additional capital to buy five bags of livestock feed, and some amount will be use for his farming. Felipe knows this loan would keep his livestock and farming business productive, and a viable source of his family income someday.

loans.use: to buy five bags of livestock feed and some amount will be used for farming

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 51 years old. She is married and has two adult children. She lives in SWP Calamba, Misamis Occiental. 

She is engaged in catering services and a buy-and-sell business, selling food such as dressed chicken, hotdogs, ham and longganisa (sausage). She has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 PHP.

Pacita has been a CUMI Member of Paglaum MPC since just last year, and is satisfied with the services that the cooperative offers. Pacita requested a new loan as additional capital, hoping that she will be able to expand her business and save more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to use in catering.

loans.name: Cheery

texts.en: Cheery is a 44-year-old married housewife with three kids. She lives in Central Brgy. Dipolog City, Zamboanga Del Norte.   She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative since January 28, 2008 and is in good standing.  She has requested her fifth loan amounting to 30,000 PHP.  As a housewife, Cheery raises pigs to help her husband with their daily needs.  She uses her money to buy feed for her pigs.  To improve their livelihood, Cheery raises more pigs and sells them to someone who buys pigs and process meat.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 41-year-old man married to Suzana, a 42-year-old woman. They are blessed with six children: Veronika, 15; Dominggus, 14, both are Junior High School students; Marianti, 8; Aldo, 7, both are Elementary School students; Lina, 5; and the youngest is Viana, 3. 

For the last 16 months, Daniel has been running a farming business. He and some friends utilize a vacant land near his home for farming. They had split their respective territories to be used for vegetables planting as desired. Before running a vegetable planting business, he used to be a fish seller, but unfortunately, due to capital struggle and other obstacles the business went bankrupt. He started the business of vegetable planting using his own capital in the amount of IDR 100,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizer.  

In addition to planting and harvesting them, Daniel also distributes the vegetables to the market by himself. The rising price of seeds and fertilizer has led him to apply for an individual loan from Kiva partner TLM in the amount of IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on seeds, fertilizer and also to pay his children's schooling fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and also to pay his children's schooling fees.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita earns a living with transport services. She is  37 years old, married and lives in Mohon, Aloran. Her business is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month.  

Melita is seeking a 14,900 PHP loan. She would like to use the loan to pay for a multicab repair. In her previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Melita is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her transportation business.

loans.use: to pay for a multicab repair.

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie is engaged in managing a hog-raising business and general store at the same time. She is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 that she will use as added capital for her pigs' growth and nutrition. She will buy hog feeds and vaccines. She will also allot the left-over amount from the loan to buying added offerings for her store. She is hoping to keep generating income in her businesses for the welfare of her three school-aged children. 

Melonie is 39 years old. She has been separated for 13 years now. She is thankful that having her hog-raising for five years is a great help to her in covering their needs. She gets PHP 2,500 net income per pig when they are sold.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en: Raheli is a 21-year-old married woman. She has one child who is three years old whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET ltd. by a Kadet officer and she has a salon shop. She has been in this business, which is located in Malindi, for three years. In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is taking her first loan of KES 15,000, which she intends to use for adding stock to her business by buying beauty cosmetics, hair food, Abuja rasta piece, cream relaxer, and hair treatment for her customers. Raheli will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To add stock of hair food, Abuja rasta piece, cream relaxer, and hair treatment to sell and use for hairdressing for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Modestina

texts.es: La señora Modestina de 38 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de 2do Toncoli, de estado civil madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores, que estudian en la escuela. La actividad económica que realiza la señora Modestina es la agricultura, perciben ingresos económicos por la venta de papa, haba, cultiva en 2 hectáreas de terreno con rotación de cultivos,  los terrenos son herencia de sus padres, Modestina necesita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como ser abono orgánico, semilla de papa. El capital que tenía lo invirtió en la mejora de su vivienda. Modestina nos comenta que ahora con el préstamo comprara los insumos para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola garantizando la seguridad alimentaria de su familia y lograra tener ahorro para el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Modestina is 38 years old and lives in the community of Segundo Toncoli.  She is a single mother with two young children who are in school.  Modestina works in farming for a living.  She earns income selling potatoes and broad beans.  She plants on 2 ha of land and rotates her crops.  She inherited her land from her parents.  Modestina needs a loan to buy farming supplies, such as organic fertilizer and potato seed.  She invested the capital she had in improving her home.  Modestina tells us that with the loan she will now buy supplies for planting on her farmland, which will guarantee that her family has food and allow her to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dympna

texts.en: Dympna is married with one child and resides in San Pedro, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte with her family. Her husband is a farmer, who provides the main source of income for the family alongside her variety store. She has been running the variety store for more than six years. Recently, she joined GDMPC and requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and biscuits for resale. She plans to use her profit to repair her store allowing her clients more convenient service.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and biscuits for resale

location.town: San Pedro Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un hombre de 64 años, vive en la ciudad de Piura en el distrito de Jayanca con su familia, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Wilfredo no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios.
Por iniciativa propia, Wilfredo trabaja como maestro constructor en diversas obras de su ciudad,el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Wilfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara herramientas y tablas para seguir con sus construcciones, así pues el seguirá esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de mantener unida a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 64, lives in Piura in the Jayanca district with his family. He is hardworking and enthusiastic and strives to get ahead. Sadly, he lacked the money to finish middle school and had to start working at an early age. Wilfredo is a master builder who works on different projects in the city every day for about eight hours. He thinks things are going well because he is dedicated and works hard.

Wilfredo is grateful to Kiva lenders because he can buy tools and boards to keep building with their support. He will strive to achieve his dream of keeping his family together.

loans.use: to buy tools and boards.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and married with four children.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She also earns additional income from clothing sales and decorative products.

Marilyn has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy the materials needed for her tailoring business.

Juliana successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Juliana's business profile again to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other fishing equipment.

Editha successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Editha's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is 54 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Milagrosa is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Milagrosa has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Levik

texts.en:
Levik is 57 years old. He lives in the village of Geghamavan which is in Gegharkunik region with his wife and disabled son. Levik’s wife does not work and they together are still engaged in farming. By the help of last Kiva loan Levik has bought 8 sheep and 1 pig for his farm and fodder for his cows and calves, and that was a great support to his family. Levik wished that his son was healthy and they together run farming activities, but unfortunately nearly everything he does alone and there are few cases that his wife can be useful to him in the farm. His wife from their house manages to sell milk, meat, cheese, butter and macun (Armenian national dairy-product). Levik also for several times has cooperated with Nor Horizon which was again turned to be very productive.
So Levik asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy ten sheep, chickens and a lot of animal fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep, chickens and a lot of animal fodder for winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Source of income.' Her biggest challenge is 'Poor roads,income lack of market.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

George was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest rate.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Client friendly.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', George replied 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. George owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen is from Sisian town. He is a lovely husband, father, and grandfather to his family of four. Shahen's daughter is married and lives separately with her family in Yerevan town. 

Shahen has been involved in the retail business for two years. He owns a store where a big variety of clothing is sold. Shahen's daughter-in-law helps him to sell clothing at the store and due to their high-quality service and kind attitude toward people, the store is in much demand in the town. Now, to increase the working capital, this hardworking man needs financial assistance. He has currently been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

So, the loan is very important for Shahen to continue his retail business. He does his best to provide good living conditions to his children and his little granddaughter Eva.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 47 years old, married, and from the Tetritskaro District. She lives with her husband and three school-age sons. Irma works as a cook at the local café and her husband is a watchman at the energy transportation company. The family has income from its farming activities as well. Specifically, they have hens and sell eggs from their house. The family income is modest and they get social assistance from the government because they live under the poverty line. Given her situation, Irma lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The start up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Irma to get a loan of 2,000 GEL and start a retail business. She will purchase stock of merchandise, such as groceries. Irma will start up a grocery store. She thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the store is opened, the family will have a stable income that will enable it to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With support of the start up program, Irma will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase stock of groceries to start a store

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a farmer from Vosketap village of Ararat region. He lives with his wife and two little daughters (7 and 2 years old). To meet the needs of the family, Artur breeds a cow and cultivates tomato and some fruits (apricot, plum, apple and pear). Artur is the only breadwinner of the family, and farming is the only source of income for them. His agribusiness currently needs some investments. The barn of the cattle is in very poor conditions and needs to be renovated. Besides, as autumn is progressing there is a need to buy some forage. A loan of USD 3000 will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling them to renovate the barn, to purchase forage for the cow and to pay for the water bills and for the workforce.

Artur will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping his maintain and develop his agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the barn, to purchase forage for the cow and to pay for the water bills and for the workforce

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en: Lusya is an experienced agronomist from the village Arshaluys of Armavir region. She lives with her husband. He is employed in the private sector. To help her husband in earning a living, Lusya is engaged in plant cultivation; she cultivates tomatoes, potatoes, and greens. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is an important source of income for the family. To be able to continue the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Lusya currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase potato seeds and some materials (cellophane, bottles) needed to build a greenhouse to cultivate plants. The loan will help the family a lot to maintain and improve their agribusiness as well as their life conditions. Lusya and her husband will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and some materials (cellophane, bottles) needed to build a greenhouse to cultivate plants

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab was born in 1992. He is single and lives with his 6 siblings and his parents at a sector in Jordan called Madaba. His father works at a vegetable store. 

Ehab has been selling fruits and vegetables using a roving car and moving to different areas. He is planning to open his own store to sell his products. Now he wants to buy another car to employ someone to sell more fruits and vegetables in order to raise his profit and income; but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a new roving car to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is a farmer from the village of Amberd in the Armavir region. She lives with her elderly pensioner parents-in-law, her husband and three school-age children (two sons and a daughter). Anahit's husband is a construction worker. To earn a living for the family, Anahit is engaged in breeding livestock  (cattle, pigs and poultry). She also cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, alfalfa, peaches, apricots, pomegranates, quince, apples and walnuts. As the family's needs are growing, Anahit needs to enlarge the agribusiness in order to cover those needs. She needs a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a pig, two calves, and some forage for the livestock. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to do it again. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Anahit was able to run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Anahit and her big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a pig, two calves, and some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
A married father of two children who lives in the Ksach Kandal District of Kandal Province, Saret is aged 43, and he does rice planting and selling dessert. With 20 years' experience in these businesses, he is able to earn up to 6 USD per day and to keep 1.5 USD each day as savings.

Saret has joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, this cycle as a second-time borrower. He is now applying for an education loan in order to pay for his daughter’s university tuition. He hopes this loan will enable him to keep his daughter in tertiary education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve his family's financial burden so he can sustain and grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s university tuition.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat was born in 1985. She is married and a mother of three. Her husband is in the military. She lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Ayat has been selling clothes and home products for one year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy them. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of clothes in order to raise her profit and income to be able to help her husband in covering their children's needs, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of clothes to resell them

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor was born in 1988. She is married, and her husband is in the military. She lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Noor has been selling blankets for a year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy blankets and clothes, but she found selling blankets is more profitable. 

Now she wants to buy a larger amount of blankets in order to raise her profit and income to be able to help her husband in covering their son’s needs. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy blankets and clothes to resell

loans.name: Wilfredo Adalberto

texts.es: Wilfredo, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace 2 años que presta servicios de fletes o acarreos de materiales de construcción de la ferretería a la casa del cliente. El prestamo que solicito es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de repuesto para la reparación de su vehículo en el que trabaja realizando su actividad económica. Esta inversión le ayudara a  mejorar sus ingresos, brindando mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es ahorrar para compra un terreno y poder hacer su casa, y también piensa en comprar un taxi.
texts.en: Wilfredo, 34, is in a common law relationship with his wife with whom he has two children; he lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  He’s been providing building supplies home delivery services for a hardware store for the last two years.  He requested a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy spare parts for the vehicle he uses for work.  This investment will help him improve his income by providing better customer service.  His goal is to save up to buy land to build his house on and he also plans to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Ada Marleny

texts.es: Ada, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada, vive con su esposo en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes. ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo cosméticos. Y hace 6 años establecio una pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como granos básicos, productos enlatados, papel higiénico, jabón, condimentos, churros, refrescos, dulces, etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo para invertirle al negocio e incrementar el inventario y las ventas. El préstamo es por 16,000 Lempiras y comprara granos básicos, productos enlatados, churros, refrescos, productos de limpieza, papel higiénico, y otros abarrotes. Ella tiene en sus planes terminar su carrera universitaria y hacer que su negocio se convierta en supermercado.
texts.en: Ada is 28 years old, married, and lives with her husband in the municipality of Omoa, Cortes.  She has always worked in sales, selling cosmetics.  Six years ago she started a small grocery store to sell food products, such as staple grains, canned goods, toilet paper, soap, condiments, churros, soft drinks, candy, etc.  Her business is in her home and she devotes all the time it needs to it.  She has requested a second loan to invest in her business and increase her inventory and her sales.  The loan is for 16,000 lempiras and she will buy staple grains, canned goods, churros, soft drinks, cleaning products, toilet paper, and other groceries.  She plans to finish her university education and convert her business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to stock up with staple grains, canned gods, churros, soft drinks, cleaning products, toilet paper, and other groceries.

loans.name: Abdelhaleem

texts.en:
Abdelhaleem was born in 1968. He is married and lives with his wife in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Wehdat. 

Abdelhaleem has been working in sewing and doing embroidery for 1 year. His wife has been helping him with his work. Abdelhaleem would like to expand his business in order to raise his income to improve their living conditions. He wants to buy new embroidery tools and materials to be more productive and to raise their sales. He doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new embroidery tools and materials.

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en: Fayzeh was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of 6. Her husband works in a private company. Fayzeh has been selling blankets for 1 year. She started her project selling a small quantity of blankets. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets in order to raise her profit and income to be able to help her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of blankets

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Orlando, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos. El trabajo unos años como taxista y jornalero, pero hace mas de 5 años decidió por su propio negocio donde vende todo tipo de mariscos como ser pescado, camarón, langosta, cangrejo, caracol y otros. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y en el mercado. Esta solicitando otro préstamo con este es el segundo ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar pescado, camarón, filete, caracol, langosta y otros para vender. Su plan es llegar a tener otro local de negocio y vender por mayor y así ayudar a su familia a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is 37 years old and in a common-law marriage. He and his wife have two children. Orlando worked for several years as a taxi driver and a day laborer, but five years ago he decided to start his own business selling all kinds of seafood. He sells fish, shrimp, lobster, crab, conches and other seafood, both from his home and in the market. 

Orlando is requesting his second loan from the field partner for 15,000 HNL to buy fish, shrimp, conches, lobster, fish fillets and other seafood to sell. He says that his plan is to open an additional location so that he can sell wholesale, which will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, conches, lobster, fish fillets and other seafood to sell.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa was born in 1990. She is married and has one son. Her husband is in the military. She lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Sanaa has been selling blankets for a year now. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy blankets. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends. 

Now she wants to add variety to her products, such as clothes, and to buy a larger amount of blankets in order to raise her profit and income and be able to help her husband in covering their son’s needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy blankets and clothes to resell

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is 19 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with her five siblings and her parents. She works in photography and is in her first year studying for a bachelor's degree in general management. She is planning to continue her studies to work in her study field after graduation. She wants to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is preventing them from paying Haya's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Qusay

texts.en: Qusay is 20 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with his three siblings and his parents. His father is a retired man who works as a driver. Qusay is in his third year studying for a bachelor's degree in accounting. He is planning to continue his study to work in the accounting field after graduation. He wants to start helping his family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which prevents them from paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rean's Group

texts.en:
Rean, 62, is married with four dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof, located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. The main source of her family’s income is from selling grocery items. Having been in this business for 13 years, she is able to earn about 80,000 KHR per day and she is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

Rean received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, one cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resale. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
Saron is a 49-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on three hectares of farmland for several years. The current business earns her about 30,000KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Saron’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each, Saron, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is 56 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer for 33 years in her village and her husband is a paid worker to help support the family. The current business earns her family about 23,000 KHR per day to feed their children. 

Phal has just connected with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her farmland so as to make a Better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en: Thouk is a mother of six children- five schoolchildren and one little kid. She and the rest of her family live in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For the family, two hectares of rice farming and a pineapple plantation are the main sources of income to cover the daily cost living. She can generate about 32,000 KHR per day. As first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Thouk and her co-borrower team up as a group of two to get a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cash-crops. She hopes to gain a good yield with a better income than before to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her son's university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Saroeun is 52 years old and married. She has five children in her household. For her family, two hectares of rice farming is her main source of her income. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years.  This is the first loan for Saroeun with Kiva partner VisionFund. For this first cycle,  she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She highly believes that she can gain a good income when she gets old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 25-year-old man living in Sana'a. Mohammed completed only secondary school and could not go ahead with his studies due to the difficult living conditions he faced. Mohammed's business is a grocery store that he started with limited capital provided by his dad. He is a hardworking man and looks forward to expanding his business. He benefited from his first loan that enabled him to attract clients. He applied for a second loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to to meet the demands of his clients by providing the needed grocery goods. In addition to getting married, he hopes to open a retail shop to increase his profit.
