loans.use: to meet the demands of his clients by stocking the requested grocery items.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, age 55 and a resident from Battambang province, is a mother of four children. She struggles for a living as she grows rice on one and half hectares of her farmland as a main source of income, while her husband has been helping her and growing vegetables to earn an extra income. 

She has been with in current business for 30 years and is enabled to earn about 31,000 KHR per day. Oun is the second client with VisionFund, and has completely repaid back. The past loan has helped her run her business timely. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR, while her group member is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the group leader, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and spend some portion to pay for the plowing and transplantation fee. 

She hopes to make a good income with the high crop yield to support her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Hakma Group

texts.en:
Hakma is a group which consists of two women and two men from Taiz, Yemen.  They asked for a 130,000 YER loan from AMB to improve their business.  Hakma is a 42-year-old married woman who has 3 children.  She didn’t complete her education because she is responsible for her family.  She started her business one year ago, selling clothes and perfumes.  She goes door-to-door to sell products, especially in her neighborhood.  She is making modest profits. 

She got a loan of 40,000 YER to expand her business.  She wants to buy a new collection of products to sell, such as clothes, perfumes, and incense.  She plans to sell them to her clients, not just in her neighborhood but also in a nearby neighborhood.  She looks forward to opening her own retail store when she earns large enough profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, and incense to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 29 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a successful entrepreneur who benefited from two previous loans. He has been operating a home products business. He feels happy about expanding his business and increasing his profit. 

He  requested only a small amount to cover the demands of his clients. He applied for a third loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. He will use this loan to buy home products to sell in his business. He thanks Kiva for financing him for the previous two loans and wishes to be financed also for this loan.

loans.use: to buy home products for his business.

loans.name: Om-Mia`ad Group

texts.en: Om-Mia`ad is the name of this three-person loan group. All of them are poor and live in Aden, Yemen. Doa`a is 29-year-old married woman with several children. She is the leader of the group, uneducated and living in a poor neighborhood in her father's house. Her husband works in the private sector but earns a low salary which is not enough to rent a house and provide food and clothing for his family. Their house is vulnerable to falling down at any time, but renovating it requires a lot of money. She started the renovations but has run out of money. She needs to complete the work, and is asking for a loan for 80,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the renovation is complete, she will start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a saving account.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her father's house.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en: Badr is a 27-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to provide a good life for his family. He is a taxi driver and from that he earns a low income. He is unable to buy home improvement items because his daily income is only enough to cover food and clothes. He intends to buy a washing machine. Therefore, he applied for a loan of 45,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine to use for his house. He hopes to furnish his house and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to use in his house.

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old, young, hardworking Iraqi man from an area still considered a conflict zone. He is married and a father of 2 children. Growing up with a farming family, he knows hard work and has been working since his childhood. 

He now has 10 years of experience with herding and raising cows to sell. The more young animals he can buy at the same time and raise simultaneously, the more income he can generate, as there is a high demand for the cows for their meat.
 
He is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to purchase more young animals.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more young animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sidonia

texts.en:
Sidonia is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married, and she has three children; this is her first loan. 

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, body crème, and eggs. 

Sidonia opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. 

She is earning a good income, and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, body crème, and eggs

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 23 years old and a hardworking single woman. She has been running a business of hand embroidery in her community for the last six years. She is a very good designer and her business is successfully growing. She is expert in her business and has a lot of experience in it. She got skills in embroidery from her mother. She designs suits and bridal dresses, and has a huge customer demand. She is a very energetic girl and has the ability to manage the business. 

Shamim has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She dreams of providing her family with a better and quality lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 55 years old and a married woman having six children. Her husband works in a factory but he does not earn enough to support his family well. It was very tough for Shamshad to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business of clothing sales buying embroidered and printed clothes of different varieties from a wholesale market and selling them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family.  

To buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs, Shamshad is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Baha's Group

texts.en:
Baha is a 26 years old Iraqi man living in an area still considered a conflict zone. He is single and in line with traditions and customs; he is living with his family. He is the owner of a small shop selling mobile phones and phone accessories – a very popular and in demand type of store for a country where the lack of land lines had created a significant market for mobile phones and every type of good related to using mobile phones ranging from replacement batteries to cute decorations.
  
Baha has 3 years of experience with the store, and understands his market and customers demands very well. To increase his capital and be able to purchase more goods in demand, he is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more goods and increase his capital.

loans.name: Grameshwardev Mahila Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2006, 10 women from the small village of Khurda, Odisha stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family and formed a group named Grameshwardev Mahila Self Help Group. All the members of this group are  women and all are engaged in petty businesses like grocery shops, vegetable shops, fruit shops, etc. One of them is Mrs. Manasi, who was selected as their president. 

Manasi is 21 years old and lives with her husband and in-laws. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She is running a small grocery shop and she has very good relationship with her customers as she sells quality products to her customers. Now she has an idea to purchase and add some more grocery items so that she can manage a monthly inventory. She, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 150,000 INR to utilize in the purchase of oil, sugar, rice, biscuits, personal care products, chocolates, etc. She wants to give a better standard of living to her family and also wants to save some money for her future.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing oil, sugar, rice, biscuits, personal care products, chocolates, etc. for her shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She opened her second hand clothing business in 2002 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy shirts, sleeves, long pants, shorts. Maria is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because its offered for poor people to improve their living conditions for the future.

loans.use: to buy shirt, sleeves, long pants, and shorts.

loans.name: Kailash

texts.en:
Kailash is a 50-year-old differently able person. He is living with his wife and children. He is engaged in maintaining a general store. He is the only earning person in his family, and this business supports and manages his family's monthly expenditures. He sells items like rice, cooking oil, sugar, soap, hair oil, etc. in his general store. 

There are 400 potential customers in his village, but he is unable to meet the customer demand. He needs to travel to the nearest market in the village with the help of his wife to refill his stock every day, depending on the demand, as he does not have funds to maintain inventory levels sufficient even for a week. 

He wants to purchase goods that he sells in his grocery shop like rice, oil, sugar, etc. in bulk, and also wants to start a small vegetable shop. He can meet the demand and earn more from his business, which will help him to control his daily cash flow. 

Kailash requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR (Indian rupees) for his business expansion. He wants to give his family a better standard of living and also wants to get his children admitted to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, flour, biscuits, etc. in bulk for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 41, is a married woman. Her husband is employed in a factory with a low salary income.  She is a mother of 8 children. 

Naseem has been involved in work of hand-embroidery for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. She also knows the method of pasting stones on embroidered cloths for embellishment. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and stones of different colors in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and stones of different colors in large quantities.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 57-year-old woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan. The financial condition of her family is not good. She is the mother of three children. All of her children are young; one of them goes to school. 

Her husband is a tailor by profession; he sews gentleman’s clothes only. He has been sewing gent’s clothes for many years and feeding his whole family. He had been taking the services of over-locking the garments from outside and paying a healthy amount for these services. Now he wants to buy an over-lock machine of his own, but he does not have the finances to purchase the machine.

He wants to buy an over-lock machine thorough his savings, but is short some amount; therefore, Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he could buy a new machine to enhance his tailoring work.

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an over-lock machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 27-year-old married woman. She is running her business of hand embroidery in her community. Her husband is a laborer. Therefore, his income is very small and not enough for his family. 

Iram is supporting her family by her business and they are living a happy life. She designs suits, bridal and traditional dresses. Her dresses are famous in her community. Her work demand is increasing day-by-day. Iram has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.  Iram is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good credit behavior in the past. She wants to enhance the business to generate more revenue and have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now applied for her third loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Sumaira hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina, age 45, is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She is involved in the work of sewing clothes to contribute to her household income. When Samina was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread earner of the family so Samina felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele.  In order to meet the demands of her customers on time, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good credit history. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz, age 36, is a married woman and a mother of four children. Her husband is employed in a factory and receives a low salary income. Shanaz has been in the business of animal purchase and sales for many years. She now wants to start a business of milk sales. For this, she needs to purchase a cow so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. This will help her to generate more income to bear her household expenses and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana, age 45, is a married woman and a mother of six children. She has been running a business of making and selling pakora. Pakora is a dish consisting of pieces of vegetable and chicken dipped in a gram flour or besan. She is expert in making good tasting pakoras and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. In order to increase her sales, Rehana needs to purchase a stock of gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. She wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Rasad

texts.en:
Rasad is 34 years old, married and he has one daughter. His wife is a doctor. Rasad is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in a central bazaar and from his home. He has five years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 
He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and it also make fresh punch. His monthly income is 120 AZN. Now, Rasad wants to repair his market but he does not have enough funds for that.
This is the first loan he is receiving through Aqroinvest. He hadn't gotten other loans from state banks before, but Aqroinvest gave him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his fruit and vegetable market

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.ru: На сегодняшний день Боймурод активно занимается скотоводством. Независимо от времени и ситуации он не оставляет своих животных и старается все время по режиму дня посещать скотный двор. Уже вошло в привычку, каждый день с раннего утра вставать кормить, поить коров и быков. Боймурод старается, чтоб у его животных всегда был корм и чувствовали себя уютно. Ведь благодаря им Боймурод может обеспечить свою семью молоком и финансовым доходом. На данный момент у него остались считанные пожилые скоты. Боймурод беспокоится за свою семью, благополучие родных зависит от его дохода. Боймурод нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить трех голов бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Он уже обращается повторно для развития своего животноводческого бизнеса.
texts.en: Currently, Boymurod is actively working in animal husbandry. Regardless of the time and situation, he never leaves his animals and tries to constantly visit the barnyard. It has become a habit for him to rise early every day to feed and water the livestock. Boymurod tries to ensure that his animals are always well-fed and feel comfortable. This is because it is due to his livestock that Boymurod can provide his family with milk and an income. At the moment, he only has a few head of older cattle. Boymurod is worried for his family since their well-being depends on his income. Boymurod needs a loan to buy three calves for cattle breeding. He has repeatedly borrowed to develop his livestock business.

loans.use: buy three calves to increase his herd.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 44 years old, married and has two daughters. Iman loves his children very much and tries to provide them with a good upbringing. He is a kind and hardworking man. According to his friends’ opinion, he is very outgoing and welcoming.

Iman loves animals and loves to feed them. He transformed his favorite occupation into a profitable business. Today he has several head of small livestock and wants to get involved in a more serious business, for example, buying and selling cattle. Of course, his wife will help him with this because it would not be easy for him to fatten up livestock and resell it by himself. 

Iman plans to request a 2,000 AZN loan to buy livestock and increase his livestock headcount. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
Santosa, de 54 años es una mujer sencilla. es viuda hace 29 años, desde entonces cuidó sola de sus 4 hijos, los que se encuentran formados y encaminados. Ahora ella vive sola en la casa que compró hace 30 años.  
En un principio sembraba y criaba animales como todas los campesinos, cuando falleció su esposo compró una casa en la plaza de la localidad, y decidió abrir una tienda de comestibles, pues no existía una en la zona, con el tiempo obtuvo muchas ganancias y incrementó la competencia, pero eso no la desmotivó pues tenía clientes fieles que nunca dejaron de comprar en su tienda. Con el paso del tiempo se consolidó y ahora es una de las más respetadas de la zona y muchos de sus habitantes comprar sus alimentos en su tienda. Ahora desea incrementar más su capital de trabajo para seguir cuidando de sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Santosa, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de productos tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Santosa, 54, is an unassuming woman; she’s been widowed for 29 years and raised her four children,  who are all formed and on their way now, alone.  She lives alone now in the house she bought 30 years ago.

At the beginning she grew crops and raised animals like all the other farmers but when her husband died she bought a house on the local main square and decided to open a grocery store because there was none in the zone.  In time she earned good profits and competition increased but this didn’t discourage her for she had loyal customers that never stopped shopping in her store.  As time went by, she became better established and today is one of the most respected shops in the zone and many of its residents buy their food from her store.

She now wants to increase working capital to continue caring for her customers.  This is her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for this progress opportunity and promises to be punctual with her payments.  Santosa will use the 1,500 soles to buy goods like rice, sugar and milk, among others, for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi, de 30 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su hija en la casa de su padre desde que nació. Hace algunos años abrió una tienda de comestibles en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ahí vendía bien y tenía muchas ganancias. Pero tuvo una propuesta económica de un hospital, por lo que empezó a trabajar ahí todos los días. Recibe un buen sueldo, con el que puede mantener a su hija, mientras que dure su trabajo, ella alquiló su tienda de comestibles con la esperanza de volver a tener su trabajo y así mejorar sus ingresos. Ahora desea mejorar su casa y así brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su hija, quien ya tendrá su propio cuarto, según menciona Noemi. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Noemí, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en el mejoramiento de los cuartos de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Noemi, 30, is a hard worker. She has lived with her daughter in her father's house since the child was born. Several years ago, she opened a food store in an air-conditioned space in the house, and sales and profits were strong. She received a job offer from a hospital and began working there every day. She earned a good salary, with which she supported her daughter. While she held the job, she rented the food store and hoped to return and increase her income.

She now wants to renovate her house and offer her daughter a better standard of living. Noemi says her daughter will have her own room. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the chance to move forward. She promises to make her payments on time. Noemí will use the 1000 soles to renovate her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Deniss

texts.es:
Deniss, de 22 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Aldo y su hijo Jean Franco a quien cuida en la casa que alquiló desde hace 4 años. Desde hace 4 años, abrió una tienda de comestibles en su hogar, la cual queda en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Comenta que la va muy bien en su trabajo tanto así que este es el único su hogar. “Con las ganancias que percibo diariamente, puedo alimentar a mis hijos”, afirma. Mientra que su esposo trabaja en una panadería, con su ganancia ahorran y cubren algunos gastos extras. Dentro de poco empezaran las clases por lo que desea comprar útiles de escritorio como lapiceros, cuadernos y demás para poder vender, es por ese motivo que necesita de un capital de trabajo. 
Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Deniss, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de productos tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Deniss, 22, is an unassuming woman living with her husband, Aldo, and son, Jean Franco, who she cares for in a house she rented four years ago.  Four years ago she opened a grocery store at home that’s centrally located in the city.  She comments that she does quite well at work so much so that this is her home’s only one.  “With profits I earn daily I’m able to feed my son,” she affirms.  Her husband works in a bakery and with his earnings they are able to save and cover extra expenses.  The school term is about to start so she needs to buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils and others to sell which is why she needs working capital.

This is her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for this progress opportunity and promises to be punctual with her payments.  Deniss will use the 1,500 soles to buy products like rice, sugar and milk, among others to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es: Ursula, de 58 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Benedicto con quien tiene 10 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, en la casa que heredó hace 20 años. Hace 5 años emprendió el trabajo de compra y venta de queso. Afirma que desde entonces tiene mayora vida y ganas de salir adelante, pues viaja cada 15 días a la capital del país donde vende los quesos que ella misma elabora con la leche que producen sus vacas, con el tiempo obtuvo más clientela por lo que empezó a acopiar queso de otros ganaderos. “Me va muy bien en mi negocio, vendo mucho queso y antes de llegar a mi pueblo ya tengo pedido de más”, afirma. Ahora ella desea comprar una vaca lechera nueva para poder aumentar la producción de su ganado, además de seguir sembrando pues le gusta vivir del campo. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios. Ursula, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de queso al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ursula, 58, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Benedicto, with whom she has 10 children but only four of them still live with her in the house she inherited 20 years ago.  Five years ago she started buying and selling cheese.  She states that since then her life’s been better and she wants to get ahead.  

She travels every two weeks to the nation’s capital to sell cheese she makes herself with milk her cows produce.  In time, she acquired more customers so started buying cheese from other cattlemen.  “I do very well in my business; I sell a lot of cheese and before I even get back to my town I already have more orders,” she affirms. She’d now like to buy another dairy cow to increase production and she wants to continue planting because she likes living in the countryside.

This is her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for this progress opportunity and promises to be punctual with her payments.  She enjoys being part of her association where they are all united and mutually supportive.  Ursula will use the 2,000 soles to buy cheese at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Jonas De Jesus

texts.es: Jonás vive en casa propia con compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra: hierro, aluminio, cobre, bronce, etc. lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jonas esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas chatarra por mayor y seguir con su trabajo para generar mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jonás lives in his own house with his life companion and their four children.  He works buying and selling recyclables: iron, aluminum, copper, bronze, etc.  He does so from place to place in various neighborhoods near his place of residence.  He’s able to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns from his work.  

Jonás is asking for a loan to be able to continue buying recyclables at wholesale and stay in business to generate higher income and provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled metal at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su madre, su esposo y sus tres hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  doña Ana está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar de zapatos por mayor, y así seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 40, lives in a relative's house with her mother, her husband, and her three children.

She makes a living as a street vendor selling shoes for women, men, and children in the various markets and neighborhoods around her home.  Ana has a lot of customers because of the quality of her products and her good prices.  She's able to pay the household expenses with what she earns and her husband's help.

Ana's requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale.  This way she can continue with her business, which is her only source of work, and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Trinidad Antonio

texts.es: Trinidad Antonio mayor de edad casado, originario del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país,donde se caracteriza por tener unas de las playas mas hermosas del país, trinidad posee en su casa de habitación desde hace 33 años una pulpería en la que vende productos de consumos para el hogar como: granos básicos, golosinas, productos congelados, detergentes, huevos, papel higiénicos, entre otros y otros productos de consumo como: frijoles cocidos, y cuajadas, donde tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales da al credito y al contado donde recupera semanal y quincenal, trinidad tiene una demanda de clientes grande debido a que su negocio esta ubicado cerca de la marina de guerra quienes son clientes fijos de el,estos los vende a otros comerciantes de pulperías y mercados, trinidad es una persona responsables con su forma de pago nuca a quedado mal, Una de sus metas es poder mejorar su negocio y lograr una estabilidad económica como tambien de mejorar su casa de habitacion, el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en su pulperia en las compras de productos como: granos basicos, detergentes, productos congelados, productos perecederos, golosinas, huevos, entre otros mas. trinidad esta muy agradecido con todos los inversionistas kivas que le brindan ayuda a las personas de bajos recursos economicos de paises pobres.
texts.en:
Trinidad Antonio is a married adult from the municipality of Chinandega, a zone located in the west of the country that’s noted for having the country’s most beautiful beaches.  

Trinidad has owned a grocery store at home for 33 years in which he sells home use products like basic grains, snacks, frozen goods, detergent, eggs, and toilet paper, among others as well as food items like cooked beans and milk curd.  He has regular customers and drop-ins he sells to on credit and for cash collecting payments weekly and biweekly.

Trinidad’s customer demand is high because his store is located near a naval base and his regular customers come from there.  He also sells to other grocers and markets.  Trinidad is a responsible man; he’s never missed a payment.  

One of his goals is to improve the business and attain economic stability and also to do some home improvements.  This loan’s objective is to invest in the grocery store with the purchase of products like basic grains, detergents, frozen goods, perishables, snacks and eggs, among others.

Trinidad is very grateful to all Kiva lenders who provide help to low-income people from poor countries.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is 38 years old. He lives in the village of Tsaghkunk, which is in Gegharkunik region. Rudik is married, and he lives with his parents, his wife and theirt two children. His parents are retired. Rudik’s wife has a specialty of nurse but she does not work outside the home; she takes care of their children. 

Rudik is a builder, but he has no constant job, and from time to time he hires out to do some construction work in his village and in Sevan city. As Rudik says his work is seasonal, so during autumn and winter months he just stays jobless.  This is the period that he fully becomes engaged in farming and agriculture. 

He breeds on his farm four cows, four heifers, four calves, sixteen sheep, a horse, and ten lambs. On his plot of land he mainly cultivates potatos and wheat, both for sale. Rudik is not afraid of hard work.  All the work around his farm he does nearly alone.

Rudik asks a loan of AMD 1,000 Armenian in order to buy three cows and a lot of animal fodder for coming winter months. 

In Nor Horizon, Rudik has paid back already two loans, and he has never been late for it.

loans.use: To buy three cows and a lot of animal fodder for coming winter months

loans.name: Younes

texts.en: Younes is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He has been working in the construction field for more than eight years. He got involved in this type of business at a very young age in order to get extra financial support for the family.  Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a ladder. As his job consists of completing wall foliage work, Younes needs to acquire that ladder to be able to reach high heights. He has two part-timers helping him with the work and he plans to hire them as full-timers as soon as he is sure that he will be able to achieve a significant expansion in his business and increase its capital thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a ladder

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола порядочная и честная девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она является студенткой 1 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета. Она окончила среднюю школу с отличными оценками и в университете тоже учится отлично. Зилола не замужем и живет с родителями. Она в свободное от занятий время помогает маме по домохозяйству. Ее родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zilola is a decent and honest girl. She is 18 years old. She is a freshman at Khujand State University. She graduated from high school with excellent grades and is studying well at the university, too. Zilola is not married and lives with her parents. In her free time, she helps her mother with the housework.  Her parents are ordinary workers cannot pay her tuition. She is asking for a loan of $350 US to pay tuition. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Yorlen Marieth

texts.es: Yorlen Marieth es madre soltera, con un hijo menor de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, tiene  24 años de edad y  reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, como ropa para niños y adultos, zapatos, bisuterías, cosméticos, al igual que ofrece todo tipo de prendas de oro, plata y laminado, acero y  entre otros, ella realiza sus compras al por mayor en uno de los mercados de otro  departamento del pais, realiza sus ventas por medio de internet a comerciantes de tiendas, y público en general al igual que de forma ambulante, ella tiene clientes fijos y eventuales a los que le vende sus productos al contado y al crédito el cual lo recupera semanalmente, ella inicio su negocio desde hace 4 años con capital propio, negocio que le ayudado a sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, Yorlen solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo con el que comprara ropa con mejores estilos y colores que le agradan a la demanda, y otros como prendas de oro, plata, acero, laminado, ella es una mujer trabajadora, honesta, responsable y con deseos de superación, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar el inventario de su negocio para para tener una estabilidad económica en su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Yorlen Marieth, 24, is a single mother who cares for her young son. She lives in the Chinandega department in western Nicaragua. She sells general merchandise such as children's and adult clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and gold, silver, and metal jewelry. She purchases merchandise at wholesale in another department in the country. She sells it to other merchants on the Internet and to the general public as a street vendor. She has regular clients, to whom she sells for cash and for credit with weekly payment terms. She started her business with her own funds four years ago to help support her young son. 

Yorlen has applied for a loan to buy better styles and more colors of clothing to meet customer demand and other items like gold, silver, and metal jewelry. She is hardworking, honest, and responsible and wants to succeed. One of her dreams is to be able to stock more inventory so that she and her family will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as clothing and shoes and gold, silver, and metal jewelry.

loans.name: Temurjon

texts.ru: Темурчону 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Темурчон после окончания средней школы успешно поступил в Горно–металлургический университет. Его родители имеют высшее образование и работают учителями в средней школе. Темурчон учится хорошо и отлично. Его родители помогают ему достать литературы и развевать его кругозор. Он имеет хорошую репутацию среди однокурсников. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор. С такой целью он запрашивает займ. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Temurjon is 18 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. After graduating from high school, Temurjon successfully enrolled in the University of Mining and Metallurgy. His parents have a higher education and work as teachers in a high school. 

Temurjon studies well and is an excellent student. His parents help him to access literature and expand his horizons. He has a good reputation among his classmates. 

He must pay his tuition. With this aim, he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Lucia Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, madres solteras con hijos mayores de edad. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En la vida ha luchado mucho para sobrevivir con su familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar sus estudios, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, en la actualidad tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de segunda mano, la cual la desempeña en sus casa de habitación y dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diaria ofreciendo  su mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es compra una paca de ropa de niño de buena calidad, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lucia’s from León, a place located in the western part of the country.  She’s a single mother of adult children.  She’s noted for being hardworking and responsible with a strong self-improvement drive.  She’s struggled much in life in order to survive with her family.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources she was unable to go to school and had to start working at a very young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and drive to move forward, her present economic activity is selling second-hand clothes at home.  She spends about 10 hours daily selling her merchandise so that in the not too distant future her income will increase.  The loan’s objective is to buy a bundle of good-quality children’s clothes so that in the not too distant future she’ll be able to earn higher income.

Lucia is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of low income in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Gulbiby

texts.ru: Гулбиби родилась в 1955 года. Она пережила очень трудную жизнь. Гулбиби рано осталась вдовой. Ее муж умер, оставив ее с 4 детьми. После смерти мужа она пережила глубокий стресс. Ей было тяжело обеспечить 4 детей. Гулбиби работает на поле. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как лук, пшеница и морковь. Гулбиби продает свой урожай на местном рынке по более низкой цене с первых рук. Ее сыновья находятся в Российской Федерации. Они там работают мастером по ремонту дома. Гулбиби и ее дети постепенно улучшают условию проживания. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbiby was born in 1955. She has endured a very difficult life. Gulbiby was left an early widow. Her husband passed away, leaving her with four children. After her husband's death, she experienced severe stress. It was difficult for her to support four children. 

Gulbiby works in the field. She is engaged in raising crops such as onions, wheat, and carrots. Gulbiby sells her harvest firsthand in the lower market for lower costs. Her sons are living in the Russian Federation. They work there as master home repairmen. 

Gulbiby and her children are improving their living conditions little by little. She plans to do home repairs. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy construction materials like cement, wood, and the like.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood for home repairs

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is 46 years old, married, and has three adult children who work. She lives with her family in Yerevan.  Her husband is a worker who does construction work. Armenuhi works as a waitress at the cafe, which she has been doing for eight years. Prior to that, she had worked as a saleswoman. 

Armenuhi’s second daughter is very ill and she is requesting a loan for 500,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to pay for the serial course of treatment of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for the serial course of treatment of her daughter

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a 56-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and mother in a small village in Dusheti district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension of 125 GEL per month. The family has no source of income. Guram is unemployed at the moment in spite of having high education. There is a high unemployment rate in the region especially among people up to the age of 40.  

As the existing income is not enough for the family and Guram can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Guram applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 900 GEL will help him to install gas equipment in his car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and provide them with inter-city transport. Guram is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to generate income and improve the living conditions for his family. This credit will be a great support for the family. Guram is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Emilsen De Jesús

texts.es: Emilsen, a sus 54 años de edad, desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de helados y mantecados producidos por ella misma en su vivienda, idea que surge con el fin de generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y sentirse útil, pues desde que le diagnosticaron una enfermedad en las articulaciones le fue imposible emplearse en una empresa. La cliente es una mujer emprendedora, activa y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello se motiva para solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (leche, azúcar, frutas), con lo que podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo y comenzar a generar ingresos. Emilsen sueña con lograr que su negocio sea rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, ampliarlo poco a poco y acreditarlo con nuevos productos, pero es consciente que para cumplir su objetivo debe trabajar arduamente, con empeño y dedicación, de esta forma podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Emilsen, 54, wants to start her own business selling ice cream that she makes in her home.  The idea came up as a way to generate income to pay for the household necessities and feel useful, because she has been unable to work for a business since she was diagnosed with a joint ailment.

Emilsen's an enterprising and active woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She's motivated to request a loan to buy supplies wholesale (milk, sugar, and fruit) with which to set up her business and begin to earn an income.

Emilsen dreams that her business will be profitable and sustainable in time and that she'll expand it little by little and stock it with new products.  She knows, however, that she has to work hard and with tenacity and dedication so she can realize her goal and be able to enjoy a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, and fruit wholesale

loans.name: Margesis

texts.es: Margesis es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas que inició hace aproximadamente dos años, aprovechando las enseñanzas de su madre quien se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante muchos años. Trabaja de Jueves a Domingo y ofrece salchipapas, arepas, empanadas, butifarras, gaseosas, entre otros y de esta manera ha generado los recursos económicos necesarios para aportar a la económica familiar. La cliente se caracteriza por su empuje y dedicación en su labor, lo que le ha permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos. Solicita el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito con el ánimo de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (carnes frías, papas, salsas, gaseosas, arepas, panes), así puede aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene y podrá ofrecer más variedad de alimentos como hamburguesas, perros calientes, chuzos, entre otros, abriendo las posibilidades de aumentar su clientela y satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus comensales, esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe. Con esto, Margesis tendrá la oportunidad de comenzar a ahorrar para pagar sus estudios universitarios, pues desea realizar una carrera que le permita disfrutar a futuro de una mejor calidad de vida, al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Margesis, 20, is a young entrepreneur working in her own business, a fast-food stand she opened about two years ago taking advantage of her mother’s teachings who has been in this business for many years.

She works Thursday to Sunday selling ‘salchipapas’ [fried potatoes with fried sausages], ‘arepas’ [filled, grilled corn cakes], turnovers, ‘butifarra’ [type of sausage], soft-drinks, etc. generating income to help with the family economy.

She’s noted for her drive and dedication at work which has helped her overcome several obstacles.  She’s asking for her first loan aiming at using it to buy ingredients at wholesale (cold-cuts, potatoes, sauces, soft-drinks, arepas, bread rolls, etc.) to take advantage of discounts offered so she can offer more variety of food like hamburgers, hot-dogs and meat kebabs, among others, leading to the possibility of increasing her clientele and satisfying more customers’ tastes which will be reflected in more sales and higher income.

With this, Margesis will have the opportunity of starting to save to pay for her university courses because she wants to study a career that will make it possible in future for her and her family to enjoy better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials at wholesale.

loans.name: Jumla

texts.en: Jumla was born in 1966. She is widowed and a mother of six. She lives with her children in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. Jumla has been selling foodstuffs at her house for two years. She started her project selling a small quantity of them. Then she increased her merchandise slowly. Jumla is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of foodstuffs in order to raise her profit and income to start supporting herself and her children after her father's death. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her mini market

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda was born in 1974. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her three children. Her husband is outside Jordan. Raeda’s daughter, Anwaar, is studying for a Bachelor of Plant Production and Agricultural Engineering. She is in her second year and is planning to continue her study to work in her field after graduation. 

In this way, she can start helping her mother, Raeda, financially, as she is currently facing financial crisis, which is not helping her in paying her daughter’s upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Raeda applied for this loan. 

Because Raeda is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter Anwaar to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael was born in 1970. He is married and has two children. One of his brothers works at a private entity. Ismael has been selling accessories, perfumes and cosmetic products for six months. He started his project with a small quantity of his products. He is planning to add variety to his products, such as stationary tools and children's games. Now he wants to add a larger quantity of cosmetic products and accessories in order to raise his sales and income to be able to support his children. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and accessories to resell them

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Since Muntaha is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Muntaha was born in 1978. She lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Zarqaa. Her husband works at a gas station. 

Muntaha has been working at her own women's salon for 12 years. She started her business after taking a course in cosmetics at a French Academy in Jordan. Then she started to buy the needed products and tools and she opened her own salon. Muntaha is planning to buy wedding dresses in the future to start trading them. 

Now, she wants to buy an air conditioner for her salon, add some decorations to it to attract more customers, and to open a store for brides' dresses that she is planning to buy in the future, for which she needs a place to keep them. This will significantly help in raising her sales and income. But, she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add an air conditioner and some decorations to the salon and to add a room to store brides' dresses.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en: Ameer is 26 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Karak with four of his siblings and his parents. He also has another two married siblings. Ameer is studying for a Bachelor of Systems Engineering and is in his 4th year. He is planning to continue his study to open his own business related to his study field after graduation in order to start helping his family financially.  They are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella lleva 6 años de tener su propia pulpería donde vende arroz, frijoles, refrescos, churos, productos de aseo, azúcar, lácteos, embutidos, condimentos, etc. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y para mantenerlo activo ha decidido solicitar un  préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos como ser carne de pollo, granos básicos, embutidos, lácteos y refrescos, y así poder tener el negocio surtido. Su plan es seguir ayudando a su hija hasta darle la educación completa y poder crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia, 39, is a single mother, has two children and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida. She has had her own grocery store for six years where she sells rice, beans, soda, churros, toiletries, sugar, dairy products, lunchmeat, condiments, etc. This business is her source of income and in order to maintain it she has decided to apply for a loan for 10,000 Lempiras.

She is going to invest it in the purchase of more products like chicken, basic grains, lunchmeat, dairy products and soda. In this manner she will be able to have variety in her business. Her plan is to continue helping her daughter, including giving her a complete education, and to be able to grow with the business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, basic grains, lunchmeat, dairy products and soda to sell.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en: Esther, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children, both boys. Both of them are still going to school. For three years now, she has been earning her living by selling ladies shoes in the market. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Esther’s seventh loan from ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner. She used the previous loans to restock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to invest in her housing project and saved the rest with ID-Ghana. She will use her portion of GHS 2000 of this loan request amount to restock by buying ladies shoes and reselling them to two weeks to customers. She is doing great and is standing in the middle of the photograph with a sample of shoes in her hand. She dreams of owning a store. Esther is taking this loan together with two other members. The members will hold each other accountable for repaying back the total loan amount of GHS 4100.

loans.use: To restock by buying ladies shoes to resell

loans.name: Doris Leticia

texts.es: Doris, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada, tiene cinco hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería (camisas, jeans, short, blusas, faldas, etc.), la venta la realiza de forma ambulante y por pedidos. El prestamo que solicito es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería para el negocio como pantalones, blusas, camisas, calcetines, shorts etc.y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos ya que tendrá mas surtido y va poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su meta es brindar el apoyo a sus hijos en la educación y mantener el negocio.
texts.en:
Doris, 38, is married with five children and lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro.  She’s been selling merchandise like shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, skirts, etc. for three years.  She sells from place to place and to order.  

She requested a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts, socks, shorts, etc. for the business to earn higher income since she’ll have wider selection on-hand and will be able to meet greater customer demand.  Her goal is to provide her children with schooling and to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel, who is in his early 40s, is married, with one child, a boy who is still going to school. 

For eight years now, Daniel has been earning his living by selling materials and also sewing for customers. He works from 7:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make enough profit. 

This will be Daniel's eighth loan from ID Ghana, Kiva's partner. He used the previous loans to restock and he has successfully paid back all his loans. Daniel used the profit to pay school fees and he saved the rest with ID Ghana. 

He will use this loan request, in the amount of GHS 1,600, to restock by buying enough materials to resell to customers. He will also sew some and sell the sewn materials. 

Daniel is doing great. He is taking this loan, together with two other people. The members will hold each other accountable for repaying the total loan amount of GHS 3,200.

loans.use: to restock by buying enough materials to sew and resell to customers.

loans.name: Jose Isabel

texts.es: Don José, tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Atima, Santa Bárbara.  Hace 20 años que se dedica a la producción de café. El cultivo lo realiza en una aldea retirado de donde vive y la producción la vende a intermediarios de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y en la limpieza de las parcelas de café. Esta inversión le ayudara a suplir la necesidad de asistencia técnica de la finca de café. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el cultivo y así poder tener una mejor calidad vida con su familia.
texts.en: José, 60, is married with two children and lives in the municipality of Atima, Santa Bárbara.  He’s been a coffee grower for 20 years.  He grows it in a village that’s far from where he lives and sells his crops to local middlemen.  The loan he’s requested is for 6,000 Lempiras he’ll use to buy fertilizer and to weed the coffee parcels.  This investment will help him meet the technical assistance need his coffee grove has.  His goal is to continue expanding his crop to attain better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to weed the coffee parcels.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 50 years old and widowed. She is responsible for providing income for her family. In 2005, she started her own business with an old sewing machine. She repairs old clothes for women and children in her neighborhood. 

Sadia is requesting a loan from Izdiharona, which she will use to buy a new sewing machine, iron, and fabric to improve the quality of her work. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits to provide a good life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, iron, and fabric.

loans.name: Ivka

texts.en:
Ivka is 63 years old and has been divorced for a long time. She is a mother of three daughters and currently lives with one of her daughters and husband in a minority community. For more than seven years now, she has owned a fast food shop near a local school. She has provided services for everyone in the community, specifically the school children who frequently stop at her place. 

In the beginning, she started very small and since has expanded, serving chicken, kebabs, hamburgers, sandwiches and such. She is now requesting a loan to pay for meat and other products to use in her shop. This loan will help her to be able to further expand her business, and in the future she would like to hire an employee. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy meat and other products for her fast food shop.

loans.name: Lubana

texts.en: Lubana is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of eight children. She has been running a business of clothing sales for two years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city at wholesale rate and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Lubana has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of clothes in different sizes and designs, taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work and effort in the business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Gul Fareen

texts.en: Gul Fareeen, a 36-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, and three children. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Gul Fareen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Gul Fareen has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Гавхар 41 год. Она замужем, имеет двух сыновей и двух дочерей и проживает со своей семьей в городе Конибодом. У Гавхар среднее специальное образование. Она работает медсестрой в течение 6 лет. Одновременно она занимается садоводством и животноводством. Ее муж находится за границей на заработках и каждый месяц высылает жене деньги на семейные расходы. Гавхар как и любая мать заботиться о своих детях, об их питании, здоровье и учебе. Ее старший сын учится на 4-ом курсе Горного металлургического Института города Чкаловска Республики Таджикистан. Остальные ее дети являются учениками школы. 
Гавхар сейчас нуждается в поддержке. Ей нужно оплатить за год обучения своего сына в Институте. Гавхар рассудительная женщина. Она думает о будущем сына и хочет, чтобы он получил высшее образование, работал по своей специальности и приносил пользу своему государству.
texts.en:
Gavhar is 41 years old. She is married, has two sons and two daughters, and lives with her family in the town of Konibodom. Gavhar has a specialized high school education. She has been working as a nurse for six years. At the same time, she is engaged in cultivating crops and raising livestock. Her husband is abroad and every month sends his wife money for family expenses. 

Like any loving mother, Gavhar takes care of her children, of their nutrition, their health and education. Her elder son is studying in the fourth year at the Chkalov City Institute of Mining and Metallurgy of the Republic of Tajikistan. The rest of her children are school pupils.

Gavhar now needs support. She needs to pay for a year's tuition for her son at the Institute. Gavhar is a sensible woman. She is thinking about her son's future and wants him to get a college degree, to work in his profession, and to be of use to his state.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son at the institute

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: Maria vive en casa en propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde desde hace varios años por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocida en la zona por ser trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su hogar y su trabajo, esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar vitaminas y concentrado. Maria tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable  y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Maria lives in a home of her own with her daughter and has been raising livestock for several years.  She has a lot of experience in this field and is well known in the area, as a hardworking, honest, and responsible woman in her home and work.  This time she wants to increase her production, but she needs working capital, so she is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL, that will allow her to buy vitamins and concentrated feed.  Maria has good references, is of unquestionable morals, and has a good payment history.  She is confident that she will be able to repay this debt while she is able to provide a good life for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María de 64 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos mayores de edad, del municipio de Malpaisillo, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Tiene por actividad económica destace de cerdos  y venta de ganado, La rutina de Rosa María es salir a comprar cerdos en las comunidades aledañas para comprar cerdos y destazarlo y vender los productos derivados del mismo como: la carne, chicharon, charrasca, frito, adobado, chingaste, moronga. Comida típica de la región .Ella dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas  diarias. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. El financiamiento  lo necesita para comprar cerdos en pie para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rosa María agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria, 64, is married and has 5 grown children.  She lives in the municipality of Malpaisillo, and is known to be a hardworking and responsible person who has a desire for personal success.  She has a business butchering pigs and selling livestock.  Rosa Maria's routine is to go out to buy pigs in the outlying communities that she can slaughter so that she can sell pork products, including: meat, pork rinds, fried pork skin, fried pork, marinated pork,  fried pork bits, and pig's blood sausage.  These are all traditional dishes in this region.  

Rosa Maria works in her business 8 hours a day, and she carries out the food preparation in her home.  She needs this loan to buy live pigs so that in the near future she can have more income.  Rosa Maria is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy live pigs for her business making pork products and dishes

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Mme Rokhaya  est une femme agée de 35 qui habite aux environs du Guichet. Mariée et mère de famille elle a préféré vendre du charbon pour souvenir aux besoins de sa famille.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité, elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Rokhaya a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbon et ensuite les vendre en détail. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l’avenir gagner le monopole du marché en achetant des camions de charbons.
texts.en:
Rokhaya is a 35-year-old woman who lives near the local branch. She is married with children, and chose to sell coal in order to support her family. 

Rokhaya has been in this line of work for more than 5 years. Her days start at 8 a.m. and end at 8 p.m. The loan will enable her to buy the bags of coal that she will then sell to retail customers. 

Rokhaya helps her husband manage their daily expenses and tuition fees for their children. In the future, she hopes to corner the market by buying a coal truck.

loans.use: to buy bags of coal to sell to retail customers.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is very happy to have a deal with Kiva lenders for the second time, since his first cooperation with them has brought decent income to his farm and to his family budget, as well (he bought fodder for his farm animals and also potato seedlings and fertilizer in advance of sowing). 

Rubik lives with his family in Ddmashen village, in the Gegharkunik region. Since Rubik has enlarged the number of his farm animals (cows, calves, sheep and chickens), the barn where he used to keep his farm cattle has become very narrow and small, so it needs to be enlarged. Rubik also is very skilled in potato cultivation, which he manages to sell at the local wholesale market. He also sells meat to butchers' shops.

So, Rubik asks for a loan of AMD 1,000,000 (Armenian drams) in order to enlarge his animal barn and to buy a calf and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to enlarge his animal barn and to buy a calf and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Santo Tomas De Joya Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana es madre soltera. Cuenta con 45 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 4 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crinza y venta de animales de corral. Inició este negocio por las necesidad de mantener a sus hijos y a la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mas animales para que su negocio crezca. Desea en el futuro que su negocio prospere y poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domésticos y al comercio.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is a single mother.  She is 45-years old.  She did not have the chance to go to school.  She has six children, four of whom go to school.  Señora Juana makes her living raising and selling farmyard animals.  She started this business out of a need to support her children, and as of today has 25 years of experience.

Señora Juana is the organizer of the communal bank.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more animals to grow her business.  She hopes, in the future, that her business prospers and that she is able to earn a better income. 

The other members of the communal bank make their livings raising domestic animals and as shop keepers.

loans.use: to purchase farmyard animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has been working since 2007 as a plumber and electrician as well. He works autonomously, serving customers wherever they are located. 

With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., he will purchase plumbing and electrical tools and supplies. He states that these purchases will surely facilitate his operations.Yehia notes that he is planning to focus on one business to develop it and be able to make a good income to live in good circumstances.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing and electrical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
La dame Khady a ouvert son compte à l’IMCEC depuis 2011, mais n’a jamais bénéficier de crédit pour autant. Elle préférait mettre de l’argent de coté. Avec la période d’hivernage, les vaches produisent beaucoup de lait car elles ont de l’herbe à brouter. C’est compte tenu de cela, que Khady veut prendre un petit crédit de 75000F CFA afin de commercialiser le « diu nior » qui est un dérivé de lait de vache. En plus de cela, elle vend aussi des draps de lit, des tissus légers achetés en Mauritanie. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine d’activité.
Khady, âgée de 38 ans est une femme divorcée et mère d’un enfant de 9 ans qu’elle prend elle-même en charge. Elle prend aussi ses besoins personnels en charge.
Dans la maison, il est prévu une boutique, elle envisage de la charger de produits qu’elle vend et de denrées alimentaires.
texts.en: Mrs. Khady has opened her account at IMCED since 2011, but has not yet benefitted from a loan. She preferred to grow her savings. With the rainy season arriving, cows produce a lot of milk as they have plenty of grass to graze on. Because of this Khady would like to take out a small loan of 75,000 West African francs in order to sell “diu noir,” a traditional product made of cow milk. In addition to this, she sells bed linens and lightweight fabrics bought in Mauritania. She has over 10 years of experience in this field. Khady, 38 years old, is divorced and brings up her nine-year old child on her own. She also supports herself. She plans to set up a store at her home to resell  her merchandise and food products.

loans.use: to buy a traditional milk product as well as lightweight fabrics and bed linens for resale.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is 21 years old and she lives with her parents in Kapan city. After graduating her school she attended hairdresser courses. At the moment she works at home and she has many loyal customers who make an appointment beforehand to have their hair done or styled with a hair dryer, or have a haircut. 

With the help of her father, recently Ani managed to buy a small space where she can have her own beauty salon. Now the building is still in process of repairing but very soon, maybe in December, the beauty salon will be ready for opening. 

Ani has requested a loan of 3.000 US dollars in order to buy furniture for her salon such as special chairs and tables with a locker and several cabinets. Also she needs to furnish the waiting room with comfort for her salon customers.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her salon and to furnish the waiting room for her salon customers

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 48 years old. He lives with his wife in the village Kavart which is in the Syunik region. His two daughters are already married and they live separately. 

After being in the army for many years, Artur worked as a driver, but since 1998 he has been engaged in bee keeping. Over the years he has become a very skilled and clever farmer. He has nearly twenty-five beehives on his farm. Artur works every day without any holidays. During the year he sells more than 200 kilograms of pure, sweet and healing honey. Artur has many loyal customers who prefer to buy only his farm’s honey. 

Artur asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy new bee hives, frames and coveralls that he needs for his work very much.

loans.use: to buy new bee hives, frames and coveralls

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is aged 32. He is single, running a retail business. He sells various drinks such as beers, sodas, juice and mineral waters. 

He has requested the loan to buy more sodas and juices to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and juices to sell.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is from the village of Akhasheni, Kakheti Region. He is 56 years old, married and lives with his wife, daughter, grown son, daughter-in-law and a grandson. The only employed person in the family is Ivane’s son, who works at the local school as a supervisor and gets a small monthly salary. Ivane has only a seasonal income from agricultural activities. He owns a garden where peaches are grown and a vineyard. Ivane works hard during the whole year to get a good harvest. His products are high quality and are sold easily at the local market. 

However, the existing funds are hardly enough to cover food costs that is the reason why Ivane decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Ivane’s wife will produce cheese to sell and for the family to consume. This loan will be a great support for Ivane’s family, as it will generate income. 

Ivane hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a dairy business.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two entrepreneurs, one of whom is 40-year-old Emmanuel. He is married and has two children, aged 12 and 8 years old. For the last seven years Emmanuel has had a business selling engine oil in the market. His wife helps him to serve customers who come to buy. 

Emmanuel is applying for a loan amount of GHS 3,000 in order to buy different brands and sizes of engine oil to sell to vehicle and machine users or owners. 

Peter is 32 years old and has a business selling electrical appliances. Together they need a total amount of GHS 5,000 to be able increase their stock and serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy different brands and sizes of engine oil to sell to vehicle and machine users or owners.

loans.name: Hannah's Group

texts.en:
