The three members of this group are married women who average 30 years of age and two children each. They all live in the same neighborhood in Dansoman in the Republic of Ghana. They all take a loan from ID-Ghana and repay without trouble. They sell wigs, assorted drinks, and assorted soap. 

Kumako is a wig and hair products seller, and she has been doing this work for one year. She is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan amount of GHS 600, she intends to purchase wigs and hair pomade so that she will serve customers better. She plans on making a profit of GHS 100 from this loan. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Together, the group is taking a total amount of GHS 4,600, which would be used to purchase various items to boost their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase wigs and hair pomade so that she will serve customers better.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Tineke

texts.en:
Tineke is an Indonesian artisan who creates exquisite Balinese jewelry. She would like to purchase silver and gemstones for her designs.

Tineke has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was the youngest of four siblings, born into a middle class family in West Sumatra. I moved to Bali after high school, and discovered more about myself. I discovered my love for art and began designing silver jewelry. I use natural materials such as silver, copper, gemstones and coconut shell. I want to preserve my traditional sense of art, and reveal what Sumatra has to the world."

A message from Tineke: "I am so grateful to be able to receive this loan. I want to create more designs and increase my stock for the holidays. Thank you for your support — it means a lot to me."

loans.use: to purchase silver and gemstones for her designs

loans.name: Muhra

texts.en:
Muhra was born in 1969. She is married and a mother of 6. Her husband is a retired man who is currently a security man. She lives with her family in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla. 

Muhra has been selling clothing and blankets for 1 year. She started her business using a small amount of money to buy blankets to trade. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends. She then added clothing sales to her business. She currently wants to buy a larger amount of clothing in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit and income. This would allow her to help her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and clothing to resell

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is an experienced agronomist from the village Getap of the Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband, her school age daughter and son (9 and 7 years old) and her little daughter (4 years old). 

Lyudmila works as an administrative assistant in the village school. She is the only employed member of the family. Lyudmila, with the help of her husband, breeds cows, hens and turkeys. She also cultivates peaches, apricots, apples, pears and walnuts. Farming is a very important source of income for them. 

To be able to cover the increasing needs of the family, Lyudmila currently needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a cow and to make previous credit repayments. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately she wasn't able to return it. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, she was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Lyudmila has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have poor credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Lyudmila and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to sustain their lives.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to make previous credit repayments

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen was born in 1993. She is married and a mother of 2. Her husband is in the military. 

Sabreen has been selling home products for 1 year. She started her project at home selling small amounts of them. Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of home products to raise her profit and income to be able to help her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products to resell

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handwoven scarves and handbags. She would like to invest in the purchase of natural materials such as tree bark and cochineal to prepare her own dyes, as well as cotton threads, to increase production in time for the holiday season. 

Clementina has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story:

"All the women in my family are weavers, and when I was a little girl my grandmother taught me how to dye with natural pigments, and how to weave. I really enjoyed the dyeing process most, and I was getting more interested in making dyes, and obtaining different colors with different techniques. I dreamed of having my own venture dedicated to rescuing and preserving our textile traditions. My dream motivated me to create my own designs and experiment with different colors. Now I am working with some women who like to dye and weave as I do."

A message from Clementina: "Thank you so much for your support! I feel blessed with this microcredit; it is an opportunity that doesn't impose interest or require so much paperwork. May God bless you all!"

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of natural materials such as tree bark and cochineal to prepare her own dyes, as well as cotton threads, to increase production in time for the holiday season

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is a hard-working young man who is striving hard to prepare for his young family. 

He still rears animals: a few cows and goats on a small scale because his income is still small and his land is limited. He hopes with the loan, he will acquire a small piece of land that he will will prepare for the animals. He hopes to stock it with the next loan he intends to get. 

He is hard-working and his goal is to break out of the poverty chain.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal, who was born in 1988, lives with her husband, a member of the military, in a sector of Jordan called Zarqaa. She has been embroidering women's dresses in her home for the past two years, and plans to open her own workshop in the future. 

In order to be more productive and increase her income, Dalal has applied for a youth loan to buy a larger quantity of the materials needed for her embroidery.

loans.use: To buy the materials needed for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette and her family are artisans who specialize in making chess sets and sculptures carved from natural stone. To continue production they would like to purchase marble and onyx in bulk.

Odette has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I am from the beautiful Mexican state of Puebla. My father, Edgar, first opened the family workshop 30 years ago. Our town is renowned throughout Mexico for its carvings in onyx and marble. Raised in this artistic heritage, we began crafting tables and other items in onyx and marble. The art of sculpting marble and onyx demands patience and dedication, both of which have been cultivated over time in the family workshop."

"Thank you so much for your support. This microcredit will allow us to continue working and will provide employment opportunities for more artisans."

loans.use: to purchase marble and onyx in bulk for her chess sets.

loans.name: Kalyamenvuv Twekulakulanye2 Group

texts.en:
Grace, a married woman and mother of four, is an enterprising woman who joined the group to to improve her social and economic situation. She sells groceries in a trading centre from which she has mobilised funds to educate her children and meet their other basic needs. 

She will use this loan to buy a fresh stock of vegetables and fruits that she will sell to her customers. She is hard-working and cooperative. The group hopes to raise their income through savings with the institution.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.
